title: natalie_portman
body:
Natalie Portman (born Natalie Hershlag, Hebrew: נטע-לי הרשלג, June 9, 1981) is an Israeli-born American actress. She has had a prolific film career since her teenage years and has starred in various blockbusters and independent films.

h1. Notable Roles
* [[Mathilda Lando]] in [[Leon the professional]]
* [[Padme Amidala]]  in [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace]], [[Star Wars: Attack of the Clones]] and [[Star Wars: Revenge of The Sith]]
* [[Nina Sayers]] in [[Black Swan (movie)|]], a movie allegedly based on  [[Perfect Blue]] 
* [[Jane Foster]] in [[Thor (2011)]], [[Thor: The Dark World]] and [[Thor: Love and Thunder]] for the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe
other_names: ナタリー・ポートマン

title: bucky_barnes
body:
James Buchanan "Bucky" Barnes is a [[Marvel]] character. He is the civilian identity of the brainwashed cyborg assassin called the [[Winter Soldier]].

Originally introduced as a sidekick to [[Captain America]], the character was created by Joe Simon and Jack Kirby and first appeared in Captain America Comics #1 (cover-dated March 1941). Barnes' original costume (or one based on it) and the Bucky nickname have been used by other heroes in the Marvel Universe over the years.

Sebastian Stan plays the character in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe.
other_names: ジェームズ・ブキャナン・バーンズ

title: tony_stark
body: Anthony Edward Stark, more commonly known as Tony Stark, is a fictional character primarily portrayed by [[Robert Downey Jr.]] in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe (MCU) media franchise—based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name—commonly known by his alias, [[Iron Man]]. Stark is initially depicted as an industrialist, genius inventor, and playboy who is CEO of Stark Industries.

title: iron_man_(2008)
body:
The first movie based on the [[Iron Man (series)|]] series. Released in 2008, and was the first film in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe.
The film stars [[Robert Downey Jr.]] as [[Tony Stark]] / [[Iron Man]] alongside Terrence Howard, Jeff Bridges, Gwyneth Paltrow, Leslie Bibb, and Shaun Toub. In the film, following his escape from captivity by a terrorist group, world-famous industrialist and master engineer Tony Stark builds a mechanized suit of armor and becomes the superhero Iron Man.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Iron Man (2008 film)":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Man_(2008_film)]

title: mobius_(marvel)
body:
Mobius M. Mobius is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer/artist Walter Simonson, the earliest incarnation of the character first appeared in [[Fantastic Four]] #346 (November 1990).
Mobius appears in the [[Marvel]]  cinematic universe (MCU) series [[loki (disney+)|Loki]] (2021–2023) and in a post-credits scene cameo in the film [[Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania]] (2023), played by [[Owen Wilson]], with Ke Huy Quan playing Ouroboros "O.B." in Loki season 2 (2023) and Matthew Macfadyen playing Mr. Paradox in the film [[Deadpool & Wolverine]] (2024).

title: wolverine_(x-men)
body:
[i][[X-Men]][/i] character known for his retractable [[claw (weapon)|claws]], healing factor, and adamantium skeleton.
Wolverine has been depicted as a member of [[X-Men]], X-Force, Alpha Flight, the [[Fantastic Four]] and The [[Avengers (series)|Avengers]]. The common depiction of Wolverine is multifaceted; he is portrayed at once as a gruff loner, susceptible to animalistic "berserker rages" despite his best efforts, while simultaneously being an incredibly knowledgeable and intelligent polyglot, strategist, and martial artist, partially due to his extended lifespan and expansive lived experiences. He has been featured in comic books, films, animation, and video games.  In live action, [[Hugh Jackman]] portrayed the character across ten installments of the [[X-Men film series]] produced by 20th Century Fox between 2000 and 2017, and reprised the role in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe (MCU).
h4. See also

* [[Wolverine crush (meme)]]
* [[X-23]]

title: runaways_(marvel)
body:
A [[Marvel]] comic book series starring a group of teenagers who rebel against their parents after discovering they're part of a secret evil organization known as "The Pride". Upon stealing tech and resources from their parents, they discover they inherited superpowers.

It was released under Marvel's 2003 Tsunami print, aiming to appeal to manga readers. It, alongside [[New Mutants]] , [[Mystique]], and [[Sentinel (X-Men)|Sentinel]] went on to be relatively successful, while [[Venom (Marvel)|Venom]], [[Human Torch]], and [[Namor]] faded into obscurity. 

It received a TV series set in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe, released on Hulu between 2017 and 2019.

title: red_guardian_(marvel)
body:
The Red Guardian (Russian: Красный страж, Krasnyy Strazh) is the name of several fictional characters appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]: Aleksey Lebedev, Alexei Shostakov, Tania Belinsky, Josef Petkus, Krassno Granitsky, Anton Ivanov, and Nikolai Kyrylenko, as well as a villainous Life Model Decoy of Shostakov. The Red Guardian is an identity that was created as the Soviet equivalent of [[Captain America]], although its use has continued after the dissolution of the [[Soviet Union]]. In the continuity of Ultimate Marvel, the Red Guardian is adapted as two separate characters: Captain Russia and Colonel Abdul al-Rahma.

Characters based on the Red Guardians have made scattered appearances in animated media and video games, with Anton Ivanov and Alexei Shostakov appearing in media set in the [[Marvel]]  cinematic universe (MCU), portrayed by Zach McGowan and David Harbour respectively.

title: cassandra_nova
body:
Cassandra Nova Xavier is a supervillain appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]], most commonly in association with the [[X-Men]]. Created by writer Grant Morrison and artist Frank Quitely, the character first appeared in New X-Men #114 (July 2001). She is a mummudrai, a parasitic life form born bodiless on the astral plane.
Cassandra is the twin sister of X-Men founder, the telepath Professor X ([[Charles Xavier]]). While in the womb together, Charles recognized her evil presence and killed her, resulting in her stillbirth.
The character made her live-action debut in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe (MCU) film [[Deadpool & Wolverine]] (2024), portrayed by Emma Corrin.

title: yelena_belova
body:
Yelena Belova (Russian: Еле́на Бело́ва) is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer Devin Grayson and artist J.G. Jones, the character appeared as a sketch in Marvel Knights: Wave 2 Sketchbook #1 (January 1998) before debuting a year later in the second volume of Inhumans #5 (January 1999) by writer Paul Jenkins and artist Jae Lee.

Florence Pugh portrays the character in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe (MCU). Pugh's version is depicted as the adopted sister of [[Natasha Romanoff]] / [[Black Widow]].

title: blind_al
body:
Althea Winifred Sanderson, better known as Blind Al, is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. She is commonly depicted as a supporting character of the antihero [[Deadpool]].

Al first appeared in Deadpool #1, living with him in "The Deadhut", his house in San Francisco. At first her relationship with him was unclear, but over time it would reveal itself as highly complex and bizarre.

Actress Leslie Uggams portrayed Blind Al in the 2016 feature film Deadpool and its 2018 sequel set in the [[X-Men film series]]. She also reprised the role in [[Deadpool & Wolverine]] (2024), set in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe (MCU).

title: spider-man_3
body:
The third and final installment of Sam Raimi's trilogy of live-action Spider-Man films. Releasing in 2007 after [[Spider-Man 2]], starring [[Tobey Maguire]] as [[Peter Parker]]/[[Spider-Man]], alongside Kirsten Dunst, James Franco, Thomas Haden Church, Topher Grace, and Bryce Dallas Howard. 

A fourth installment, titled Spider-Man 4, was set to be released on May 6, 2011, followed by a Venom spin-off film, along with a fifth and sixth installment, but all were canceled. The Spider-Man film series was rebooted twice; first with [[The Amazing Spider-Man]] (2012) starring [[Andrew Garfield]]; and later a new film series set within the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe (MCU) starring [[Tom Holland]].

h4. See also

title: mg08
body:
The German version of the common [[Maxim gun]] design, the MG08 was the primary general-purpose [[machine gun]] of the [[Imperial German Army]] during [[World War I]], and continued to be used by the German military during the Weimar Republic era and as an emplaced "fortress" gun during [[World War II]].

The MG08 saw several modifications during the Great War, including using a perforated water jacket to turn the weapon into an air-cooled gun for use in German warplanes. The Army also worked on a reduced-weight version to turn the weapon into a [[light machine gun]], that would wind up being the [[MG08/15]] and it's later development the [[MG08/18]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Vickers machine gun]] The British version of the Maxim gun. 
* [[PM1910]] The Russian version of the Maxim gun. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: MG 08":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MG_08]

title: sentry_(marvel)
body:
The Sentry (Robert "Bob" Reynolds) and The Void are respectively a superhero and supervillain appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by Paul Jenkins and Jae Lee, with uncredited conceptual contributions by Rick Veitch, the characters first appeared in The Sentry #1 (2000).

Robert "Bob" Reynolds / Sentry and the Void appears in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe (MCU) portrayed by Lewis Pullman.

title: x-men_film_series
body:
X-Men is an American superhero film series based on the [[Marvel]] Comics [[X-men|superhero team of the same name]]. [[20th_century_studios|20th Century Fox]] obtained the film rights to the team and other related characters in 1994 for $2.6 million. After numerous drafts, Bryan Singer was hired to direct the first film, released in 2000.

[[Deadpool & Wolverine]] (2024) integrates [[Deadpool]] from Fox's X-Men film series in the [[Marvel]] cinematic universe and retains the R rating of the previous films, making it the first MCU film to have such a rating.

title: chadwick_boseman
body:
[b]Chadwick Aaron Boseman[/b] (November 29, 1976 – August 28, 2020) was an American actor. His role as the superhero [[Black Panther (marvel)|]] in the [[Marvel]] films, including [[Black Panther (movie)|]], made him an international star, winning him an NAACP Image Award and a Screen Actors Guild Award.

Boseman died on August 28, 2020, after privately dealing with colon cancer for four years.

title: natasha_romanoff
body: Natalia Alianovna Romanova, more commonly known as Natasha Romanoff, is a fictional character primarily portrayed by [[Scarlett Johannson]] in the [[Marvel]] (MCU) media franchise—based on the [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] character of the same name—sometimes known by her alias, [[Black Widow]]. Romanoff is depicted as an expert spy and hand-to-hand combatant, trained in the Red Room from childhood to be a KGB assassin. This brought her under S.H.I.E.L.D.'s radar, and Clint Barton was sent to kill her but instead spared her life and recruited her into the organization.
other_names: ナターシャ・ロマノフ

title: mockingbird_(marvel)
body:
[b]Mockingbird[/b] is a fictional superhero from [[Marvel]] comics. Also known as Agent 19, Barbara "Bobbi" Morse is an agent of the fictional SHIELD agency who is skilled in using two staves in combat and is the ex-wife of [[Clint Barton]] aka, [[Hawkeye (marvel)|]].

In the [[Marvel]] tv series, [[Agents of Shield]], Mockingbird/Bobbi Morse is played by Adrianne Palicki. Unlike in the comics, Bobbi is not Clint's ex-wife but was once married to Lance Hunter, a former British commando. Strangely, in the Disney+ show [[Hawkeye (disney+)|]], Clint's wife, Laura Barton, who is portrayed by Linda Cardellini, is revealed in the season finale to be a former SHIELD agent codenamed Agent 19, Mockingbird's codename in the comics. It is currently unclear if this means that the MCU retcon Agents of Shield as non-canon with Laura being Mockingbird all along or that Laura was the previous Mockingbird before giving up her mantle and codename to Bobbi after marrying Clint.

title: dc_extended_universe
body:
The DC Extended Universe (shortened as the DCEU) was an American media franchise and shared universe centered on a series of superhero films and television series produced by DC Films and distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures. It is based on characters that appear in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]].
A new rebooted franchise of films and television series, the [[DC Universe (franchise)|DC Universe]] (DCU), was relased by James Gunn and Peter Safran, who were appointed co-chairmen and co-CEOs of DC Studios in a late-2022 restructuring. Certain DCEU characters, such as Peacemaker, Amanda Waller, and Blue Beetle, will be moved to the DCU, while the second season of Peacemaker take place in the new universe.

title: audi_r8
body:
A [[sports car|supercar]] produced by [[Audi]], first released in 2006. Audi has announced that 2023 would be the final model year for the R8, with no current word on a successor.

The R8 has several appearances in popular media, most notably as [[Tony Stark]]/[[Iron Man]]'s personal car throughout the [[Marvel]] films, and one was used as the vehicle mode for [[Sideways (transformers)|]] in [i][[Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen]][/i]. 
The [b]Audi Le Mans Quattro[/b], the concept car that the R8 is based on, also appeared in [i][[Need for Speed: Carbon]][/i] as the car of Darius, the main antagonist.

title: infinity_gems
body: The [b]Infinity Gems[/b], referred to in the [[Marvel|MCU]] and modern comics as the [b]Infinity Stones[/b], are a set of six [[gem]]s found in comics published by [[Marvel]]. Each gem gives its user power over a certain fundamental aspect of the universe (Time, Space, Mind, Soul, Power and Reality), and they are oftentimes used in tandem via the [[Infinity Gauntlet]].

title: zendaya
body: [b]Zendaya Maree Stoermer Coleman[/b] (September 1, 1996) is an American actress and singer. Known for her roles as Rue Bennett in [[HBO]]'s Teen Drama [[Euphoria (2019)|]], [[Chani]] in Denis Villeneuve's [[Dune (series)|]] movies and famously as [[Michelle "MJ" Jones]] in the [[Marvel]] [[Spider-man (series)|]] movies. Is currently engaged to her Spider-Man costar [[Tom Holland]], who plays as [[Peter Parker]]/[[Spider-Man]] in the MCU.

title: carol_danvers
body:
[[Marvel]] character. Originally debuted as a supporting character in the original Mar-Vell's Captain Marvel comics, Carol Danvers is a [[United States Air Force]] officer who later gains powers of her own and becomes [[Ms. Marvel]]. In 2012, she took on the [[Captain Marvel]] mantle herself, though she has also temporarily gone by the superhero aliases of [b]Binary[/b] and [b]Warbird[/b] prior to her current name.

Carol is typically depicted with [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her powers as a superhero include [[flying|flight]], increased strength, and energy projection. She is portrayed by Brie Larson in the [[Marvel]] films.

title: chris_evans
body:
Christopher Robert Evans (born June 13, 1981) is an American actor. He gained attention for his portrayal of [[Marvel]] Comics character the [[Human Torch]] in [[Fantastic Four (2005)]] and Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer (2007). Evans made further appearances in film adaptations of comic books and graphic novels: [[teenage mutant ninja turtles|TMNT]] (2007), [[Scott Pilgrim vs the World (movie)|Scott Pilgrim vs. the World]] (2010), and [[Snowpiercer]] (2013).
Evans gained wider recognition for portraying [[Steve Rogers]] / [[Captain America]] in various [[Marvel]] films, from [[Captain America: The First Avenger]] (2011) to [[Avengers: Endgame]] (2019).
other_names: クリストファー・ロバート・エヴァンス

title: moon_knight
body:
[[Marvel]] superhero. His civilian name is [[Marc Spector]], but due to his dissociative identity disorder he has taken several other civilian personas, including [[Steven Grant]], Jake Lockley, and [[Mr. Knight]]. He's a ruthless vigilante who communicates with the Egyptian god Khonsu, although it might be just another voice in his head.

Moon Knight debuted into the [[marvel|MCU]] in his own [[moon Knight (Disney+)|Disney+ series]], where he is portrayed by [[Oscar Isaac]]. The show depicts him as far more mystical than the comics, with no ambiguity regarding the power of Egyptian gods.

title: thor_(marvel)_(series)
body: A series of comics and movies within the [[Marvel]] universe centered around [[Thor (marvel)|]].

title: neria_(dragon_raja_(lee_yeongdo))
body: A character from Lee Yeongdo's [[Dragon Raja (Lee Yeongdo)|]]. A [[red_hair|red-haired]] young woman, she is a thief and an agile fighter.

title: eldritch_abomination
body:
A type of creature defined by their complete disregard for the natural laws of the universe as we understand them and the love for [[body horror]]. Their physical form (if they even have one) is so bizarre, it even can make someone mad just by looking at it. 

All [[H P Lovecraft|Lovecraftian]] [[horror (theme)|]]s ([[Cthulhu]], [[Hastur]], [[Nyarlathotep]], etc.) are of this type.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: H. P. Lovecraft":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._P._Lovecraft
* "Wikipedia: Lovecraftian Horror":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovecraftian_horror

body:
[[carmilla (swimsuit rider) (fate)|Carmilla Swimsuit Rider]] in her First Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She wears a wide-brimmed red hat, sunglasses, a red dress with a black see-through layer beneath, and black sandals. Her two Doberman dogs accompany her for her attacks.

Since she fancies herself as the phantom thief Mistress C, this design may or may not be a reference to [[Carmen Sandiego]].

title: ereshkigal_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant first appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] chapter as an NPC. In Mesopotamian mythology, Ereshkigal is the ruler of Irkalla, or the land of the dead. She is also [[Ishtar (fate)|]]'s sister, which is why she takes on the appearance of [[Tohsaka Rin]], [[tohsaka_rin_(true_appearance)_(fate/extra)|but with]] [[blonde hair]]. Additionally, Ereshkigal's hair becomes [[very long hair|very long]] in her Third Ascension. She was released as a playable servant during the [[Meikai no Merry Christmas]] event. An alternate Beast-class version from the [[Servant Universe (fate)|]] known as [[Space Ereshkigal (fate)|]] was released for the game's ninth anniversary.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Morii Shizuki]]
[b]Voice Actress[/b]: [[Ueda Kana]]

She is a welfare Servant obtained from the event, so her outfit does not change with Ascension levels. She wears a [[pink jacket]] that completely covers up her swimsuit, which she states is a [[white one-piece swimsuit]], as is slightly more visible in her final ascension art (in addition to a [[black bow]] at the top). She switches to two different outfits during her [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]] animation, a [[blue kimono]] and a [[blue dress]].

title: takane_lui
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "holoX". Designed by [[Kakage]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] with [[pink wings|same-colored]] [[head wings]], [[blue eyes]] (which she can turn [[orange eyes|orange]] with [[crosshair pupils]]), and [[large breasts]]. She also has [[long legs]] and [[wide hips]] with a noticeable [[thigh gap]] which gives her a very particular silhouette that some fans compare to a tuning fork.
Her default hairstyle is [[short hair|short]] [[parted hair]] held with a [[black hairband]] and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]].

Artists sometimes depict her as a [[Takane Lui (hawk)|hawk]] (especially in HOLOTORI group arts), and a bald eagle.

She is sometimes seen accompanied by her partner/caretaker, [[Ganmo (takane lui)|]] the [[frogmouth]], and two younglings: a smaller chick with one feather-ahoge named [[Tsumire (takane lui)|]], and a slightly larger chick with three feather-ahoges named [[Tsukune (takane lui)|]].

title: string_of_fate
body:
The red string of fate ([i]unmei no akai ito[/i], 運命の赤い糸) is an East Asian belief that every person in the world is connected to another by an invisible red string tied to the little finger of their left hand. The two people connected by the red string are destined to be lovers.

It is similar to the Western concept of soulmates. The concept is popularly referenced in anime and manga. Notable examples include [[Ai Yori Aoshi]] and [[Kimagure Orange Road]], which frequently reference this concept.

h4.See also

* [[heart of string]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Red thread of fate":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_thread_of_fate

title: elu_(nijisanji)
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], part of the inaugural batch of eight. Designed by [[Hoojiro]]. Often only referred to as 'Elu' or 'Elu the Elf', her full name is "Snow White Paradise El Santo Flow Wasurena Pure Princess Livre Love Heidern Dokodoko Yattaze Valkyria Passion Alfr Noel Chakoboshi Eluaria Frosia Made-in Bloom Elu" (スノー・ホワイト・パラダイス・エルサント・フロウ・ワスレナ・ピュア・プリンセス・リーブル・ラブ・ハイデルン・ドコドコ・ヤッタゼ・ヴァルキュリア・パッション・アールヴ・ノエル・チャコボシ・エルアリア・フロージア・メイドイン・ブルーム・エル), a name so long it would inspire "a song whose lyrics are just her reading it out":[https://youtu.be/K2dutYkhZ3c].

Her physical form is defined by [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[pointy ears|elf ears]] and [[fairy wings|wings]], [[red eyes]], and a [[large breasts|large]] or [[medium breasts|medium bust]]-size that depends on her official appearance.

title: raidian_(arknights)
body:
A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]February 21st[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Liberi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]159 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]10 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An elite operator of Rhodes Island who was described as warm and friendly with persistent motherliness towards younger operators and patients.

Initially appears as a [i]Stronghold Protocol[/i] exclusive [i]Decel Binder[/i] Supporter, later become fully playable as a reward from the Integrated Strategies [i]Sui's Garden of Grotesqueries[/i], with her mechanics redesigned and subclass changed to [i]Summoner[/i]. 

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Fukui Yukari]] (JP) and Shi Congwu (CN). Her illustrator is [[aZLing]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #9868738: Default
* !post #9868739: Elite II

title: patchwork_clothes
body:
Clothes created from various pieces or scraps of fabric being sewn together. Could be intended design choice or the result of the person not having sufficient fabric to make their clothes from one cloth, often an indicator in art of poverty. 

Note that "patchwork clothes" implies that patching either makes up the clothes entierly or a very significant part of the clothes. If there is only a few patches on the clothes use [[patch]] instead.

H4. Examples

title: hizack
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-106 Hizack (High Performance Zaku)[/b]

A [[mobile suit]] developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] based on the legendary [[Zaku II]] series from [[Zeon]]. 

In order to snuff out the Zeon remnants, the Hizacks were made to greatly resemble the Zaku, but packed much more powerful beam weapons in addition to the Zaku [[machine gun]]s. [[Earth Federation]] Hizacks are blue colored, while the Titans opted for the classic Zaku II green color scheme for their units. 

The Hizack replaced the [[GM Quel]] and was the standard Titans MS at the start of [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]], but was quickly replaced itself by the [[Marasai]], as the [[AEUG]]/[[aeug|Karaba]] [[rick_dias|standard MS models]] proved to be more powerful.

After The Gryps War some grey colored units were seen deployed by the [[Neo Zeon]] [[full_frontal|Sleeves]] during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on Torrington base]].

h4. Variants
* [[Hizack Custom]]
* [[Hizack Cannon]]
* [[EWAC Zack]]
* [[zaku_marine_type|Marine Hizack]]

* [[Hobby Hizack]]

title: nea_d_campbell
body:
[spoiler]Known by many other names like "The Pianist", "The Musician", "The 14th Noah", "The Renegade Noah" or even "The Traitorous 14th", Nea D. Campbell is a [[Noah (D.Gray-Man)]] and a disowned member of the Clan Of Noah. He betrayed the Clan Of Noah by massacring almost all incarnations of the Noah at that time for reasons that are still uncertain, only sparing [[Road Kamelot]] and [[Mana Walker]].[spoiler]

[spoiler]Nea is the younger twin brother of [[Mana Walker]] and the adoptive uncle of protagonist, [[Allen Walker]]. He and Mana once used to be one person and form the original [[Millennium Earl]] before the Earl got split in two and became two people. Who would go on to be Mana and Nea.[spoiler]

[spoiler]He currently resides in the body and conscious of the protagonist, [[Allen Walker]], who is his host and whom he plans to erase completely and take over the body of. And can even possess for some time[spoiler]

Nea's usual look and outfit consist of [[short hair]], [[purple hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[white shirt]], [[collared shirt]], [[black vest]], [[red ribbon]], [[trench coat]], [[brown coat]], [[black pants]] and [[boots]]

[spoiler]when he is possessing [[Allen Walker]], Allen's eyes are glowing yellow (see [[Allen_Walker_(Nea D Campbell)]] for reference)[spoiler]

title: teacup
body:
A [[cup]] traditionally used to hold [[tea]] and other hot beverages. They're typically short and made of ceramic, with a rounded base and a handle. They're often depicted alongside [[saucer]]s, [[teapot]]s, and [[tea set]]s.

In Japan, tea-drinking may be done with [[yunomi]]: these are cylindrical cups without handles. And a [[chawan]] is a bowl-shaped cup without handles, found in East Asia.

In China, a traditional cup used for tea-drinking - often seen with a lid - is a [[gaiwan]].

h4. Examples

* !post #9306535

h4. See also

* [[Disposable coffee cup]]

* [[Spinning teacup]] (amusement ride)
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: gaiwan
body:
Chinese [[tea]] brewing vessel that can be used in place of a [[teapot]] or simply as a drinking [[cup]].

Gaiwan consists of a [[bowl]], a [[lid]], and a [[saucer]]. They are typically small enough that all three parts can be picked up in one hand. 

Developed during the Ming Dynasty, it is considered the preferred method for brewing teas with delicate flavors.

A similar Japanese equivalent is the [[chawan]], which is different in shape, and less often depicted with a lid.

h4. See Also

* [[Tag Group:Food tags]]

title: kar98k_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[mauser 98|Mauser Kar98K]] bolt-action [[rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[pink eyes]], and wears a [[black hat]] with the [[Iron Cross]], [[black skirt]], a large [[jacket on shoulders|coat over her shoulders]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh]] [[boots]]. Infamously, her official art portrays her with a comically [[oversized object|oversized]] Kar98k, which has led to some fanart depicting her as quite small. 

Her portrait is used as the game's app icon, and she features with [[Lee-Enfield (girls' frontline)|]] in the initial loading screen. Despite this focus in early promotional material, her illustrator [[Samail]] did not contribute much for her for years due to outside factors. Would receive a [[Kar98K (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

title: soushin_shoujo_matoi
body:
[b]Soushin Shoujo Matoi[/b] (装神少女まとい) is a Japanese [[magical girl]] anime television series produced by White Fox.


h4. Summary
[[Sumeragi Matoi|Matoi Sumeragi]] wishes for nothing more than to lead a normal life away from the spotlight. She is quite satisfied alternating between school and her part-time job at her best friend [[Kusanagi Yuma|Yuma Kusanagi]] 's family shrine. But this routine life is permanently disturbed when a Night—an evil extra-dimensional entity—attacks the shrine. Matoi is able to drive it off after unwittingly calling upon the powers of a god, the natural enemies of the Nights.

Matoi and Yuma are soon joined by [[clarus_tonitrus|Claris Tonitolus]], an experienced exorcist from the Vatican, and agent Haruka Luciela, who works for the secretive Night defense organization IATO. Despite not knowing the perpetrator behind these attacks nor their motive, Matoi must come to master this newfound power in order to protect both the people around her and the once normal life she holds so dear.

h4. Characters

* [[Sumeragi Matoi|Matoi Sumeragi]]
* [[Kusanagi Yuma|Yuma Kusanagi]]
* [[clarus_tonitrus|Claris Tonitolus]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website":http://www.matoi-anime.com/

title: chiyu
body:
A Virtual Net Idol, the first of her genre of fictional characters having their own websites (alongside the parallel phenomena of Jikon websites). Opened on the 14th of February, 2001, the [[chiyu 12-sai|perpetually 12 year old]] VNI would become a hit as the year went on.

Beyond her website, Chiyu would partner up with several entities, and contribute to magazines as well, including the Japanese magazine Netrunner, which would not only create a figure of her, but also have her star in the OVA [[Netrunmon]] (voiced by Momoi Haruko).

Following the rise of [[virtual YouTuber]]s, Chiyu was credited as one of the Pioneers in the field, alongside others such as Ami Yamato (debut 2011), Weatheroid Airi (debut 2012), Sayo-chan (debut 2013), and Infinite Loop's ILtan (あいえるたん).

Chiyu herself would end up debuting as a VTuber on the 14th of February, 2018.

h4. External links

* Website: https://tiyu.to/
* Twitter: https://x.com/tiyu12sai
other_names: バーチャルネットアイドルちゆ12歳

title: no_russian_(meme)
body:
"No Russian" is an infamous level from the 2009 [[video game]] [[Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2]] in which the player partakes in a [[terrorist]] attack which involves shooting at and killing unarmed civilians at a Russian [[airport]].

Before committing the [[massacre]], the main antagonist [[vladimir_r_makarov|Vladimir Makarov]] says [b]"Remember – no Russian"[/b] to the player (an undercover [[CIA]] agent, who assumed the identity of one of Makarov's followers) as they were about to get out of the [[elevator]]. In the original context, the phase was meant to instruct his followers to only speak in English to hide their Russian identity (this is to further enforce the idea that, in addition to their use of Western-manufactured weapons such as the [[m4 carbine|M4A1]] and the [[M240]], the attack was orchestrated by an American-affiliated group). However, the quote "No Russian" has been misattributed into Makarov instructing his followers into killing any Russian they come across, therefore it has been used as a "snowclone":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/snowclone] on the internet.

The mission drew controversy in the media for its portrayal of a terrorist attack which the player can choose to partake in. Because of the nature of the mission, it can be skipped entirely without impeding the game progression.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: No Russian / Remember - no Russian":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/no-russian-remember-no-russian]
* "Wikipedia: No Russian":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_Russian

title: testicular_torsion
body: The twisting of the spermatic cord, cutting off blood supply to the [[testicles]]. Often caused by vigorous physical activity or injuries, it causes a great amount of pain, and, if left untreated, permanent infertility.

title: reiuji_utsuho
body:
The "Scorching, Troublesome Divine Flame". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Subterranean Animism]][/i] and later a playable character in [i][[touhou_hisoutensoku|Hisoutensoku]][/i]. A hell raven who absorbed the powers of a [[yatagarasu]], giving her the power to manipulate nuclear fusion which she then used to try to conquer the surface. Her nickname is "Okuu" (おくう), which is based on an alternate reading of the kanji in her name. Both Reiuji and [[Kaenbyou Rin]] are pets of [[Komeiji Satori]] and live in [[Chireiden]]. 

Her (fan-given) catchprase is '[[Unyu]]'; she is also known as [[circled 6|⑥]] because, like [[Cirno]] (whose nickname is [[circled 9|⑨]]), she is rather dumb and the strongest of the Former Hell, only difference is, she actually [i]is[/i] strong.  "⑥" also reflects her status as a Stage 6 boss, and the notion of her heat-based powers being the inverse of Cirno and her ice abilities.

Her spellcards are announced with a highly visible [[radiation symbol]] and while [[pointing up]] towards the [[black sun]], often while holding her [[arm cannon]] based on a [[control rod (touhou)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] or [[brown hair]] tied with a [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow]] and [[red eyes]], including her [[third eye]] on her chest. Her outfit is a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and sometimes [[frilled shirt|frills on the bottom]] and the [[frilled shirt collar|collar]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[green skirt]], a [[white cape]] with a [[starry sky print|starry]] [[print cape|print]] on the [[two-sided cape|reverse side]] over her [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings|wings]], [[black socks]], and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #23743151: [[Sunken Fossil World]]

title: rapunzel_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the Pioneer squad along with [[Scarlet (Nikke)|Scarlet]] and [[Snow White (Nikke)|Snow White]]. A saint-like figure who appeases the spirits of those who have died on the surface. Often found lost in prayer, she is also prone to reminiscence. [spoiler]In spite of her innocent attitude, she is a huge pervert. This salacious mind has been attributed to a long-gone friend "[[red_hood_(nikke)|Red Hood]]" who is fond of adult magazines.[/spoiler]

Like all members of [[Pioneer (Nikke)|]], Rapunzel is named after the titular character of the [[Rapunzel (fairy tale)|German fairy tale of the same name]]. 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair|yellow hair]] tied to a [[braid]]. She wears a [[nun]]-themed outfit consists of a [[black robe]], and an [[armored bodysuit]]. She also carries a [[staff]]-esque [[rocket launcher]].

title: modernia_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]. A member of the Queen's elite squad, the [[Heretics (nikke)|]].

[spoilers]She is [[Marian (nikke)|]]'s current form, having been recovered and repaired by Rapture forces following her apparent euthanization.[/spoilers]

After engaging the Counters several times, she would be purged of her corruption through a substance known as "Vapaus". However, the Rapture "Chatterbox" in its dying moments would force a hard mental reset which left Modernia in a toddler-like mental state, [spoilers]though she still remains fond of the word "Commander"[/spoilers]. She is currently being taken care of by the [[Pioneer (nikke)|]] Pilgrims while on the run from Ark authorities, who hope to cut her up and reverse-engineer the Rapture technology within her body.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[sidelocks]], wearing [[bandaged head|bandages on her head]]. She's a [[mecha musume]] wearing [[armor]] and a [[bodysuit]], showing her [[large breasts]]. Wears [[black gloves|black]] [[armored gloves|armored]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[shoulder armor]], a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon]], [[armored boots|armored]] [[high heel boots]], and is usually carrying her [[submachine gun]]. She also has a [[mechanical tail]].

Illustrator: [[KKUEM]]
Voice actress: [[Hanazawa Kana]] (JP)

title: little_mermaid_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. Also known as "Siren", She is part of the [[Old Tales (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Cinderella (nikke)|]], [[Hansel (nikke)|]] & [[Gretel (nikke)|]], and [[Red Shoes (nikke)|]].

She has [[blue hair|dark blue]]/[[black hair]] which is [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[colored inner hair|on the inside]] set in [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long]] [[twintails]], and [[yellow eyes]]. She has a relatively tall and slender build compared to most Nikke, with [[medium breasts]]. She wears a blue/black [[skintight]], [[sleeveless]] [[halterneck]] [[backless_outfit|backless]] [[bodysuit]] with a hexagonal pattern, [[neon trim|neon-aqua highlights]] and [[see-through cleavage]], along with [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]].

[spoiler]She possesses a "Kotodama" akin to [[Maiden (nikke)|]]'s; her mark appears on her lower lip instead of tongue. Hers is still a prototype and she uses it with more difficulty and less control. In particular, it can activate unintentionally if she says the wrong thing (anything which could be construed as a command).[/spoiler]

For this reason (and in reference to her namesake), she does not speak under normal circumstances. [spoiler]She developed a means of controlling her ability by the time the event Unbreakable Sphere occurs.  While she is now able to freely speak to others, she still frequently responds by making simple sounds.[/spoiler]

Like her predecessors and her squad, she is named after the "folk tale of the same name":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Little_Mermaid].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31694740: [[Little Mermaid (Abyss Flower) (Nikke)|Abyss Flower]]

title: crown_(naked_king)_(nikke)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Goddess Of Victory: Nikke]]'s [[Crown (Nikke)|]].

According to [[Chime (Nikke)|]], this "outfit" was created to absorb Alva Particles, then converted into a weapon of mass destruction by a wandering monk. Due to nonexistent weight of the outfit, the wearer is completely unaffected by the thermal shockwaves it dispenses.

As the name suggests, this "outfit" consists only of a single [[white robe]] and an energy [[crown]] and nothing else, leaving the wearer [[naked robe|essentially naked]].  There are four [[floating hand]]s around the user to which they can be used to release an energy beam. For censorship reason, there are two x-shaped ray (explained in-game as the Alva Particle absorbed by this outfit) [[convenient censoring|covering the breasts and crotch]], though this is usually omitted in fanarts.

Very likely to be a reference to [[Emperor's New clothes|The Emperor's New Clothes]].

title: cinderella_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]. She is a member of the [[Old Tales (Nikke)|]] squad, the second generation of Grimms models, along with [[Red Shoes (nikke)|]], [[Little Mermaid (nikke)|]], [[Hansel (nikke)|]] and [[Gretel (nikke)|]].

Formerly known as [b]Anachiro[/b], she was created by [[Abe (nikke)|]] and was supposed to assist the [[Goddess (nikke)|Goddess Squad]] in an operation to kill the Rapture Queen. [spoiler]She was eventually corrupted by her friend, Red Shoes who wanted to use her as a gateway in achieving unity with the Raptures. This results in humanity officially declaring their defeat against the Raptures and the subsequent retreatment to the Ark, an underground city.[/spoiler]

[[Liliweiss (nikke)|]] said that Cinderella uses Blitzkrieg tactics: employing overwhelming force to achieve victory as quickly as possible. Due to this, Cinderella is believed to exceed the strengths and abilities of each individual Goddess member.

Like her predecessors and her squad, her name and by extension, her weaponry, is named after the [[Cinderella (fairy tale)|folk tale of the same name]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied in [[twintails]] and [[large breasts]]. She originally had [[blue eyes]], but now currently has [[red eyes]] at post-corruption. Her outfit consists of a [[backless outfit|backless]] [[white leotard]] with [[turtleneck]] and [[clothing cutout|cutout]] around her [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] and [[armpit cutout|armpits]] which extends down to her legs.

Illustrator: [[Yoya Yogurt]]
Voice actress: [[Yuuki Aoi]]

title: pumbaa
body: Pumbaa is major character in Disney's 1994 animated feature film [[The Lion King]] and the deuteragonist of the 2004 film The Lion King 1½. He is a gluttonous warthog and the best friend of [[Timon (the lion king)|]], a meerkat. Most animals are dismissive of Pumbaa due to his repugnant odor, but he remains happy-go-lucky by following a philosophy called "Hakuna Matata".

title: hyena
body:
A feliform mammal that primarily resides within Africa. Hyenas possess traits of both cats and dogs; they groom and mate similarly to felines, yet hunt like canines.

[[Shenzi (the lion king)|]], [[Banzai (the lion king)|]] and [[Ed (the lion king)|]] from [[The Lion King]] are popular examples of hyenas in modern culture.

title: komeiji_koishi
body:
The "Closed Eyes of Love". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Subterranean Animism]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]], [[Urban Legend In Limbo]], and [[Antinomy Of Common Flowers]]

A "Satori":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satori_%28folklore%29 [[traditional youkai|youkai]]. Koishi has sealed off her mind-reading ability (represented by the fact her third eye is closed) so she would not experience the fear and loathing her older [[sisters|sister]] [[Komeiji_Satori|Satori]] suffered.  This indirectly gave her a new power, the ability to manipulate the [i]subconscious[/i]. Her own conscious mind was sealed away as well, and she no longer has a real personality or desires. Koishi now wanders [[Gensokyo]], going wherever her subconscious wills her.

h4. Appearance

title: patchouli_knowledge
body:
The "Unmoving Great Library". Stage 4 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character in the first few fighting games.

A magician youkai, resident librarian and instructor of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]'s [[Voile]] [[library]], and a close friend to [[Remilia Scarlet]]. She has mastery over the seven elements corresponding to Japanese weekday names - Sun, Moon, Fire, Metal, Wood, Water and Earth - earning her the nickname "One-Week Wizard", but her reclusive lifestyle (she's apparently not left her library in 100 years, which is interpreted in some doujins as signs of [[hikikomori]] behavior) has taken a toll on her health, limiting her powers by way of asthma and anemia. Due to her baggy clothing, her bust size and overall body shape are still open to debate.

On [[NicoNico]], she is linked to [[Gachimuchi]] thanks to "a certain misheard line":https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm2852390 uttered by [[Billy Herrington]]. Such images are tagged with: "Patchouli, Urgh!" in Pixiv.

She has [[very long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[purple eyes|matching eyes]], and [[multiple hair bows|multiple]] [[blue bow|blue]] and [[red bow|red]]/[[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|hair bows]]. She wears a [[pink hat|pink]] or [[white hat|white]] [[mob cap]] with a [[crescent hat ornament|crescent ornament]] on it, as well as a [[hat ribbon|ribbon]], and single or [[double bun]] [[bun cover|covers]]. She also wears a [[vertical-striped dress|vertically striped]], [[purple dress]] under a [[pink robe]] with [[long sleeves|long]], [[wide sleeves]], and has [[white shoes]] or [[purple boots]] with [[footwear bow|bows]] on them.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3276498: Profile

h4. See also

* "[[Mukyuu]]", a nonsensical catchphrase attributed to her
* [[Catchouli (hazuki ruu)|]], a disgustingly adorable [[chibi]] [[cat girl]] version created by [[Hazuki Ruu]]
* [[Patchoung (aoshima)|]], a version of her created by [[Aoshima]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Patchouli Knowledge":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Patchouli_Knowledge

title: koakuma
body:
A [[demon girl|female devil]]. Stage 4 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] who lives in the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]], often seen in the [[Voile]] [[Library]]. Her name literally translates to "Little Demon", leading to some ambiguity whether or not it is her real name.

It is generally assumed by the majority of fans that Koakuma is [[Patchouli Knowledge|Patchouli's]] summoned familiar and personal assistant, as she is rarely seen outside of the library unless accompanying the magician, and served as Patchouli's midboss in EoSD. She's also frequently depicted as a succubus in fanworks, despite [[ZUN]] calling her more of an imp and her exact species being unknown. Unused sprites in the EoSD game files include a possible "EX-Koakuma" with violet hair and a purple arcane aura, which might have been meant to appear alongside Patchouli during the Extra Stage midboss fight.

In [[Whispered Oracle of Hakurei Shrine]], her ability has been revealed as "capable of finding target book in an instant", which can be interpreted as she listens to the books' "whispers/sounds" and triangulates their location like some kind of bat sonar. In the same work, It is also states that she is like a magical creature similar to [[Patchouli Knowledge|Patchouli]] and the various fairies, which is in line with [[ZUN]]'s definition of "Devil":[https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Devil], where he describes them as 'large species that can include vampires and magicians among other similar things'.

She has [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[black wings|black]] [[demon wings]] on her [[head wings|head]] and back, and occasionally has a [[demon tail]] too. Her outfit is a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[red necktie]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[black vest]] and [[black skirt|skirt]], either [[white socks]] or [[black pantyhose]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]].

She's part of the [[Underworld Queen (nikke)|]] squad together with [[Sakura (Nikke)|]] and [[Rosanna (Nikke)|]], an anti-crime unit that oversees areas of the Outer Rim and the Ark. She is the leader of the Peony Association, also known as the Templars. Due to her stubborness and airheaded attitude, she is often picked upon by her fellow squad mates.

title: nero_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She is a member of [[Happy Zoo (nikke)|]] along with [[Biscuit (nikke)|]] and [[Leona (nikke)|]], the Ark's animal management squad. 

Nero is rather soft-spoken and befitting of her appearance, is exclusively fond of [[cat]]s. She is responsible for looking after the cats at the animal shelter, being very knowledgeable and is capable of communicating with them as well. She displays several feline behaviors herself like preferring high places, chasing moving objects, liking [[box]]es and [[meowing]] while speaking.

Nero is a [[cat girl]] with [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[purple eyes]], [[black nails]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[two-tone bikini|two-tone]] [[black bikini|black]] and [[white bikini|white]] [[string bikini]], a [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[black skirt|black]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[pink belt]], a [[detached collar|detached]] [[wing collar]], a pink and black [[chest harness]] with a single [[pouch]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[paw print palms]], striped [[arm warmers]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[pink thighhighs|pink thighhigh]] on her right leg, a [[thigh strap]] on her left leg and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]]. In her hair, she has [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon]]s and a [[hairclip]], and also has a [[pink bow|pink]] [[tail bow]].

She wields a [[submachine gun]] called Meow Meow.

Illustrator: 
Voice actresses: [[Taketatsu Ayana]] (JP) and Jalitza Delgado (EN)

title: mary_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A talented doctor who treats her patients with unsurpassed care. In [[Seraphim (nikke)|]], she is known as the Angel in White. As for patients who disobey her orders, however...

A member and nurse for Seraphim, a medical squad along with [[Pepper (nikke)|]]. [spoiler]Prior to becoming a Nikke, Mary was a nurse who was falsifying the autopsy records of dead patients and selling their brains. A fellow nurse who would later become 'Pepper' discovered this, became infuriated, and killed Mary by pushing her down a flight of stairs.[/spoiler]

title: leona_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She is a member of [[Happy Zoo (nikke)|]] along with [[Biscuit (nikke)|]] and [[Nero (nikke)|]], the Ark's animal management squad. Often accompanied by a [[white fur|white]] [[lion]] named [[Timi (nikke)|]].

Leona is playful and friendly and is the oldest member of Happy Zoo. She is entrusted to take care of large carnivorous animals at the animal shelter, including [[lion]]s, [[tiger]]s, [[bear]]s and [[wolf|wolves]], and is capable of making even the most disobedient animal obey her. Ironically, she is afraid of small animals, as she is afraid that she might hurt them. As opposed to her squadmates, Leona doesn't display any animalistic behaviors.

Leona has [[animal ears]] and a [[tail]], [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[sidelocks]], [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[ringed eyes]], [[pink nails]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[turtleneck]] [[sideless shirt]] that shows some [[sideboob]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]] with [[zipper]]s on her [[sleeve zipper|wrists]], a [[grey sports bra]] with [[underwear writing|writing]] that says "I Like Bunnies", [[bike shorts]] a [[white belt]], [[grey socks]] and a pair of [[white boots|white]] [[high heel boots]]. She has [[butterfly tattoo]]s on the back of her [[shoulder tattoo|right shoulder]] and on both of her [[wrist tattoo|wrists]].

She wields a [[shotgun]] called Lion's Roar.

title: crust_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She is the leader of [[Cooking Oil (nikke)|]], which consists of her and [[Bready (nikke)|]].

Crust is a professional [[chef]] who is renowned for making delicious dishes that taste out of this world. Her role in the squad is to interpret the data that Bready gives her and uses it to create new meals. She also hosts a [[cooking show]] called "Crunchy Cooking Class". She is very friendly and energetic, and loves making people happy with her dishes.

Crust has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[low twin braids]] with [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]s, [[hair intakes]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[collared dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[white hat|white]] [[chef hat]], a [[red bowtie]], a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron]] with a [[pink bow]], [[white gloves]], [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and a pair of [[red shoes|red]] [[mary janes]]. In her hair, she has two [[strawberry hair ornament]]s, a single pink [[hair bow]], and a [[rabbit hair ornament]]. Carries a [[spatula]] by her waist.

She wields a [[rocket launcher]] called Whip, Pop, Ding!.

body:

Bready is the taste tester for the squad, as she has a very sensitive [[tongue]] which allows her to discern the ingredients and nutrional value of what she is tasting, as well as getting information about an item's components and history. Despite her appearance, Bready prefers to sample [[food]] and can become very addicted to flavors she likes. Although she doesn't like the flavor of humans, she loves the taste of the [[Commander (nikke)|]], as he tastes very sweet and doesn't trigger her super sense.

Bready has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[low twintails]] with [[brown ribbon|brown]] [[hair ribbon]], [[brown eyes]], [[black nails]], [[large breasts]] and is rather [[plump]]. She wears a [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy long sleeves]] showing her [[belly]] and some [[underboob]], a [[black neckerchief]], a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]], [[black choker]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[ribbon-trimmed thighhighs]] and a pair of [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]].

title: biscuit_(nikke)
body:

Biscuit is very playful, energetic and loves attention. Due to her ability to communicate with animals, her responsibilities consist of rescuing stray and abused animals. She is especially fond of [[dog]]s, taking great care of them and even working as a dog-sitter. She displays several canine behaviors herself like enjoying [[pet food|dog food]], playing fetch and having a good sense of smell for tracking things.

Biscuit is a [[dog girl]] with [[dog ears]] and a [[dog tail]], [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[yellow eyes]], [[medium breasts]] (or [[large breasts]] in relation to her frame) and [[fangs]]. She wears a [[short dress|short]] [[grey dress|grey]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] with [[puffy long sleeves]], a [[white bowtie|white]] and [[black bowtie|black]] [[checkered bowtie]], a [[black belt]], several [[heart brooch]]es, a [[whistle]] [[whistle around neck|around her neck]], [[grey socks|grey]] [[ribbed socks]] and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]]. In her hair, she has several [[grey bow|grey]] [[hair bow]]s, a [[bone hair ornament]] on top of a [[heart hair ornament]], and [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]].

She wields a [[rocket launcher]] called Happy Puppy.

title: anis_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the [[Counters (nikke)|]] squad along with [[rapi (nikke)|Rapi]] and [[neon (nikke)|Neon]], Anis is the most cocky and sarcastic among the three. Despite this, she is still loyal, obedient and caring to her squad, especially to the [[commander (nikke)|commander]].

[spoiler]Anis used to be an idol from trio group known as "Twinkle Tri-Star", alongside [[Mint (nikke)|]] and [[Prika (nikke)|]]. She retired eventually due to personal reasons, and eventually became a member of Counters.[/spoiler]

Like her other former idol's members, Anis is named after "anise":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anise], a herb.

She has [[yellow eyes|yellow]]/[[brown eyes]], [[huge breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]]. She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]], [[black jacket]], [[grey shirt|grey]]/[[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], [[thigh strap]]s, and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. Depicted [[holding gun|holding]] a [[grenade launcher]] and has several [[40mm grenade]]s strapped to her default gear.

title: ceroba_ketsukane
body:
Ceroba Ketsukane is a [spoilers]primary antagonist (along with [[Flowey (Undertale)]])[/spoilers] in [[Undertale Yellow]].

Ceroba is a [[fox girl|fox-like]] monster with beige fur and [[long hair|long]] , [[wavy hair|wavy]] ginger hair. Her hair is tied up in a ponytail by a [[red ribbon]] with a small gold bell in the centre. She has a long, [[white kimono]] with red trimmings; a [[red sash|red obi sash]] tied around her waist and [[white boots]].

During her battle phases, she carries a long red staff with a bright yellow bell at the end two little red ribbons tied around the ends of the bell. In the Pacifist Route battle, she wears the [[fox mask|Kitsune mask]] made by [[Kanako Ketsukane|Kanako]], consisting of two dark eye sockets that receive bright red dots in the final phase, with pink dyes. Her hair becomes more voluminous, resembling tails with pink shine. Additionally, she wears a cloak that is shown in concept art to be yellowish-white with pink edges.

Her attacks in the overworld are represented as white and pink flashes of light.

title: baekje_middle_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of Baekje Middle School in [[After School Lessons for Unripe Apples]].

The [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[green jacket|green]] [[blazer]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt]], a [[pink necktie|pink]]/[[purple necktie|purple]] [[plaid necktie]] for boys or [[cross tie]] for girls, [[plaid pants]]/[[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[medium skirt|medium-length skirt]], and a [[pink vest|pink]]/[[purple vest|purple]] [[plaid vest]] for girls.

The [[summer uniform]] keeps the skirts and pants the same, but [[short sleeves|shortens]] the sleeves and removes the neckties/cross ties, vests featured in the girls uniform, and blazers, as well as adding a [[sailor collar]] to the girls uniform. 

[[Name tag]]s are also part of the school's uniform but are seldom included in illustrations.

Despite this, her desire to survive remains incredibly strong. She believes that life is still worth clinging to, even if it means living in abject poverty and misery. She’s one of the Nikkes full of stories.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[sidelocks]] which is tied in [[twintails]] held by metallic headgear (not ribbons). body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

She is a member of [[Matis (Nikke)|]] along with [[laplace (nikke)|Laplace]] and [[maxwell (nikke)|Maxwell]], Drake often presents herself as a villain among the three, however this often puts her in unfortunate situations such as inadvertently doing good deeds. Aside from her villain-like motif, Drake is often presented as a naive and airheaded Nikke, much to [[Maxwell (nikke)|]]'s dismay.

Like other members of Matis, Drake is named after a famous scientist, namely the late astronomer [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Drake](Frank Drake), who is known for the Drake equation.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] which has a [[hairclip]] attached on it. She has [[small breasts]]. She has [[short hair|short]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[black hair]] and [[green eyes]] with [[large breasts]]. title: sora_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She is a member of [[Over the Horizon (nikke)|]] along with [[Cielo (Nikke)|]] and [[Sky (Nikke)|]], the Ark's aeronautical squad.

Sora is a [[flight attendant|stewardess]] for the squad and is responsible for ensuring the safety of all passengers on board. She is very friendly, [[flirting|flirtatious]] and accommodating, and has a love for flying. However, she harbors a dark secret, she has been smuggling materials and resources from the surface to the Outer Rim, with a goal of uncovering the Wings of Victory, the [[aircraft]] piloted by the [[Goddess (nikke)|]] Squad.

Sora has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[parted bangs|parted]] [[blunt bangs]], [[red eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears an [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket]] with her [[id card]] on the left [[lapels|lapel]], a [[white shirt]] that leaves her [[black bra]] [[bra visible through clothes|partially visible]], a [[black choker]], [[black belt]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pencil skirt]] with a [[side slit]], [[white pantyhose]] and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]]. She has a [[wireless earphones|wireless earphone]] in her right ear, a [[single earring]] on her left ear and [[multiple rings]]. She is also depicted with rolls of [[money]] and a [[smartphone]] in each of her pockets and has several hidden pockets inside her jacket holding various items.

She wields a [[rocket launcher]] called Turbulence.

Illustrator: [[Dfm (darknessdfm)|DarknessDFM]]
Voice actresses: [[Sakura Kaoru (voice actor)|]] (JP) and [[Cassandra Lee Morris]] (EN)

title: poli_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of A.C.P.U., a mobile patrol squad, along with [[Miranda (Nikke)|]] and [[Quiry (Nikke)|]].

A member of the Ark police force and captain of the [[A.C.P.U. (nikke)|]] Squad. Her appearance and her temperament are like that of a little puppy. Though she can be rather careless sometimes, she's a real professional at work and always does a perfect job.

[b]Five Nights at Freddy's[/b], abbreviated as [b]FNAF[/b] , is a series of indie survival horror game series made by Scott Cawthon in which the player must protect themselves from hostile animatronics. body:

Made popular as a comedic gesture in anime and manga by the character of [[Vinegar Doppio]] in Part 5 of [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. The character uses objects such as [[unworn shoes|shoes]], [[frog]]s, and an [[ice cream cone]] to speak to his [[Diavolo|boss]].

title: the_binding_of_isaac
body:
An indie roguelike horror video game created by Edmund McMillen and Florian Himsl. It was initially released in 2011 for PC.

The story plays out like a modern retelling of the titular story from the Bible. [[Isaac (the binding of isaac)|]] is a young boy living with his mother. Things are swell, until one day Mom hears a voice from someone she believes to be God, who eventually tells her to kill her son. Isaac, having learned about this, flees in terror to the basement via a secret trapdoor. [spoiler]How much of this story is real (if anything at all) is left up to debate.[/spoiler]

The game takes primary inspiration from [[The Legend of Zelda]] games, with top-down dungeons to explore, plenty of monsters to fight, and lots of treasure to collect.

It received a full remake in 2014 titled [i]The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth[/i]. On top of the original game, [i]Rebirth[/i] introduces a lot of new enemies, levels, characters, and items. While initially released on PC and the like, Nicalis would help port it over to consoles such as [[Playstation 4]] and [[Nintendo Switch]], the latter of which comes bundled with all of the DLC up to that point ([[the binding of isaac: afterbirth|Afterbirth]] and Afterbirth+, though Repentance needs to be bought separately).

title: supergirl_(2015)
body:
A 2015 superhero tv series based on [[DC Comics]]' [[Supergirl]] that aired from 2015 to 2021 for six seasons. While it originally aired on CBS during the first season, it later aired on CW starting from the second season thanks to a popular crossover episode with CW's [[The Flash (series)|]] in the first season. 

While the show was originally set in a different universe than CW's "Arrowverse", which includes [[Green Arrow (series)|Arrow]], The Flash and Legends of Tomorrow, the multiple episodes crossover "[b]Crisis on Infinite Earths[/b]" would combine them into one universe including [[Batwoman]] and [[Black Lightning (dc)|]]. 

The series follows Kara Danvers, a young woman at CatCo Worldwide Media in National City, who is actually a Kryptonian and the cousin of [[Superman]]. 

When the planet Krypton was about to explode, Kara's parents send her on an escape pod to not only escape to Earth but to protect her baby cousin Kal-El who was sent on another escape pod. However, Kara's ship got knocked off course into the Phantom Zone, where she gets trapped, frozen in time before her ship escapes and Kara arrives on Earth to discover not only 24 years have passed but her cousin, now Clark Kent, is now an adult and a superhero called Superman. To take care of her and learn how to live like a regular human, Superman sends his cousin to his trusted friends, the Danvers family, to raise Kara.

In the present, Kara one day uses her powers to secertly stop a plane from crashing, which the press praise her heroics and dub her "Supergirl". Deciding to be a superhero just like her cousin, Kara embraces her Kryptonian heritage and becomes the defender of National City. Helping her is her adoptive older sister, [[Alex Danvers]], who is an agent of the Department of Extra-Normal Operations (DEO), an American agency that protects Earth from hostile aliens and [[Jimmy Olsen]], Superman's best friend.

title: rick_dom
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

[b]MS-09R Rick Dom[/b]

The Rick Dom is a variant of the [[Zeon]] MS-09B [[Dom (mobile suit)|]] [[mobile suit]] made for [[space]] combat. It retains its parent design's tough armor and cross-shaped visor, while integrating multiple added [[thrusters]] in its redesigned legs for excellent mobility in space.

h4. See also
* [[Rick Dias]]

title: quess_paraya
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. She first appeared in the [[Char's Counterattack]] anime film from 1988. 

[b]Quess Paraya[/b] is the rebellious teen daughter of an important [[Earth Federation]] official. She has [[aqua hair]] and [[twintails]].

[spoilers]A powerful latent newtype who is taken in by [[Char Aznable]]'s [[Neo Zeon]] and given a [[jagd_doga_quess_custom|Jagd Doga]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] and later the [[Alpha Azieru]] [[mobile armor]]. 

During the final space battle of The Second Neo Zeon War Quess is accidentaly killed by [[Chan Agi]] (who pilots a damaged [[Re-GZ]]) while trying to protect [[Hathaway Noa]]. Then Chan is herself killed by an enraged Hathaway in a [[Jegan]]. These events would haunt Hathaway for the rest of his life and serve as catalysts for his transformation into [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]] and [[gundam_hathaway's_flash|his fight against the corrupt Earth Federation]] years later.[/spoilers]

title: forge
body: A [[furnace]] used by [[blacksmith]]s and other metalworkers.  Used to heat up metal in order to make it softer and thus easier to form into the desired shape.  The word may also be used in an expansive way to refer to the artisan's entire workshop.

title: gelgoog_jager
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0080]].

[b]MS-14JG Gelgoog Jäger[/b]

A higher performance variant of the [[Gelgoog]] [[mobile suit]] deployed by the Principality of [[Zeon]] during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. 

It has an improved reactor output enabling the new model to load a heavy beam machine gun as well as the two Beam Spot Guns on the forearms. Its vast array of sensors and precision equipment generally pushed the type into sniping missions, in which they excelled.

title: steinway_&_sons
body:
Steinway & Sons is a German-American piano company, founded in 1853 in New York City by German piano builder Heinrich Engelhard Steinweg (later known as Henry E. Steinway). The company's growth led to a move to a larger factory in New York, and later opening an additional factory in Hamburg, Germany. 
Steinway is a prominent piano company, known for its high quality and for inventions within the area of piano development. Steinway has been granted 139 patents in piano making, with the first in 1857. The company's share of the high-end grand piano market consistently exceeds 80 percent. The dominant position has been criticized, with some musicians and writers arguing that it has blocked innovation and led to a homogenization of the sound favored by pianists.

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steinway_%26_Sons

title: gelgoog
body:
A [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeated in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979. 

The [b]MS-14A Gelgoog[/b] is [[Zeon]]'s final and best mass produced [[mobile suit]] during The One Year War. Extremely fast, powerful and armed with the cutting edge beam weapon technology (a [[beam rifle]] and a [[beam naginata]]), this advanced series of suits could even challenge the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]].

It served in almost as many variations as its predecessor, the Zaku, including a limited run of High Mobility Types and the higher spec [[Gelgoog S Char Custom]], famously used by [[Char Aznable]].

h4. Some variants
* [[Gelgoog Marine]]

* [[Gelgoog Anavel Gato Custom]]

title: gelgoog_cannon
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]MS-14C Gelgoog Cannon[/b]

A support fire variant of the [[Gelgoog]] [[mobile suit]] deployed by the Principality of [[Zeon]] during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. 

The type's high base specs and addition of the High Mobility Type backpack enabled the support type to remain a formidable opponent in combat while gaining the ability to provide long range support courtesy of its shoulder mounted [[beam cannon]].

title: zaku_desert_type
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]MS-06D Zaku Desert Type[/b]

A mass-produced desert combat [[mobile suit]] and one of many variants of the standard MS-06 [[Zaku II]] created and used by the Principality of [[Zeon]] during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]].

As many units of this model were used in remote desert areas where Zeon remnants hid after they lost the war, it was present and reappeared modified and used by [[Neo Zeon]] during later conflicts like [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]] and [[gundam_unicorn|The Attack on Torrington Base]].

title: mailbox_(incoming_mail)
body:
A physical receptacle into which postal carriers deliver incoming mail, to be picked up by the recipient. Also known as a letterbox*, letter plate, letter hole, mail slot, etc. ("Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Letter_box]).  Some mailboxes feature an arm that can be flipped up to indicate that there is some outgoing mail within for the postal carrier to retrieve when they come by delivering mail.

Examples: post #951740, post #913214


For tagging purposes, distinct from [[postbox (outgoing mail)]], which is for outgoing mail.


*However, [[letterboxed|letterbox]] is used here to refer to the image composition technique.

title: postbox_(outgoing_mail)
body:
A physical receptacle into which outgoing mail items may be deposited for collection and subsequent delivery by the postal service. Also known as collection box, drop box, etc. ("Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postbox)

For tagging purposes, distinct from [[mailbox (incoming mail)]], which is for incoming mail.

h4. Examples

* !post #870912: Modern Japanese postbox
* !post #888398: Older [[japanese cylindrical postbox|cylindrical version]]
* !post #7764205: US postbox on the left

title: genocider_shou
body:
A character from [[Danganronpa (series)|]], titled the Ultimate Murderous Fiend (超高校級の「殺人鬼」chō kōkō kyū no “satsujinki” lit. Super High School Level Murderer). Her name is sometimes spelled as Genocider Syo (Genocide Jack/Jill in the English release). [spoiler][[Fukawa Toko]]'s second personality.[/spoiler]

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]] or [[brown hair]], [[red eyes]], [[sharp teeth]], and a [[long tongue]] which is almost always [[tongue out|out]]. Often seen wielding one or more pairs of [[scissors]]. Has a crush on [[Togami Byakuya]].

In [[Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc|Trigger Happy Havoc]], she wears her hair in [[twin braids]]. In [[Danganronpa Another Episode: Ultra Despair Girls|Ultra Despair Girls]], she wears her [[hair down]]; it is also [[messy hair|messy]], and she has a [[lightning ahoge]] and several [[hairclip]]s.

h4. External links
* "Danganronpa Wiki":https://danganronpa.fandom.com/wiki/Genocide_Jack

title: marian_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She is a former member of Silver Gun.

The first Nikke which the [[Commander (nikke)|]] encounters. Despite being the first playable Nikke in the game's tutorial, she is not unlockable as a playable character.

[spoiler]After Marian is corrupted by the [[Rapture (nikke)|]]s, the Commander has to euthanize her, with her last words thanking them for a bandage. It is later revealed that [[Modernia (Nikke)|]] is her new reincarnation.[/spoiler]

The [[commander (nikke)|]] would later discover that [[Enikk (nikke)|]] and [[Chatterbox (nikke)|]] had made a deal: the Raptures would not attack the Ark in exchange for a regular sacrifice of Nikkes to be used as servants for the [[Rapture Queen (nikke)|]], [spoiler]with Marian being the latest and last Nikke to be offered.[/spoiler]

Marian has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[purple eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]] that shows some [[sideboob]], a [[short necktie|short]] [[blue necktie]], a [[blue hat|blue]] [[garrison cap]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[high-waist skirt]] with a [[side slit]], [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], [[black pantyhose]] and a pair of [[black boots]]. She also has a [[brown belt]] with multiple [[belt pouch|pouches]] and a [[walkie-talkie]], a [[white cape|white]] [[two-sided cape]] and a [[thigh strap]] with a [[thigh holster|holster]] on her right leg.

She wields a [[submachine gun]] called First Affection.

[spoiler]Do not use this tag with [[Modernia (nikke)|]] unless both forms are present, as Modernia is specifically for Marian's new form.[/spoiler]

Illustrator: [[KKUEM]]
Voice Actresses: [[Hanazawa Kana]] (JP) and [[Ryan Bartley]] (EN)

h4. Appearance

* !post #6254216: Default

h4. External links

* "Nikkepedia: Marian":https://nikke-goddess-of-victory-international.fandom.com/wiki/Marian

title: eunhwa_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

The leader of the [[Absolute (nikke)|]] squad who evokes an air of both arrogance and composure. Her perfectionism has pushed Absolute up to the pinnacle of success. The Absolute squad consists of Eunhwa herself, [[Emma (nikke)|]] and [[Vesti (nikke)|]].

[spoiler]Originally a human commander who was ditched by her own Nikkes after deeming her an amateur, she was wiped out by a Rapture attack including her own Nikkes. After befriending [[Rapi (nikke)|]] as a Nikke from Absolute, both Eunhwa and Rapi became the "perfect partner" until Rapi accidentally murdered a human with one of her explosives during a mission. Her departure from the squad without official leave has left Eunhwa betrayed and has since been embittered by Rapi's departure.[/spoiler]

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] showing off her [[forehead]]. She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]], a [[black leotard|black]] [[collared leotard]] under a [[black serafuku]] with a [[red neckerchief]], and a [[black jacket|black]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[jacket]] on top of that.

Illustrator: [[Hyulla]]

title: diesel_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of Infinity Rail.

She is the leader of Infinity Rail who took [[Brid (nikke)|]]'s place and has a fondness for strawberry candies. She operates the AZX, the Ark's high-speed train.

She has [[brown eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[military hat|military]] [[peaked cap]], [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[military jacket|military]] [[jacket on shoulders]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue necktie|blue]] [[striped necktie]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], [[thigh belt]], [[thigh pouch]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. Usually depicted [[holding gun|holding]] an [[rpk]] [[light machine gun]].

In her past life as a human, Diesel was a member of the AFX, a locomotive that is likely the predecessor to the AZX, alongside the people who would later be known as Brid and [[Soline (nikke)|]] respectively. However, a terrorist bombing instigated by [[Crow (nikke)|]] occurs, killing Diesel alongside her little brother and the other passengers of AFX. All the female passengers killed eventually became Nikkes who worked in the railways.

h4. Appearance

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[black coat|black]] [[long coat|long]] [[hooded coat]] with her [[hood up]], wears a [[black shirt]] with [[tactical clothes]] on top, wears [[black gloves]], [[grey shorts|grey]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[short shorts]], with a [[holster]] where she carries a [[gun]], she also wears [[black footwear|black]] and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]]. Can be seen carrying a [[hatchet (axe)|]] during her missions along with her [[submachine gun]] and a [[bag]] on her back.

title: isaki_riona
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and member of of [[hololive DEV_IS]]' 2nd group [[FLOW GLOW (hololive)|]]. Designed by [[shirabi]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied into a [[one side up]] held with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] with [[long hair between eyes|nose-length]] [[double-parted bangs]] and [[sidelocks]].

Her default costume consists a [[black jacket]] which she wears [[off shoulder]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[high collar|high-collared]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[two-tone pants|two-tone]] [[black pants|black]] and [[white pants]] with [[detached pants|detachable legs]] giving the impression of [[knee cutout]]s and [[black sneakers|black]] [[high tops]]. She also has a spiked [[earclip]] on one ear and an [[ear chain]] on the other as well as a [[navel piercing]].

h4. Costumes

* !post #8398056: Default

h5. Other costumes

* !post #9677728: [[Isaki Riona (Holonatsu Paradise)|holoNatsu Paradise]]

h4. External links

* "YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/@IsakiRiona
* "Twitter":https://x.com/isakiriona

title: subaru_duck
body:
[[Oozora Subaru]]'s "3D" model. Thanks to her hilariously bad attempts at [[ASMR]], she has been compared to [[Donald Duck]] and then, [[duck]]s in general. Thus, in this form, she appears as a white duck with her signature baseball cap. Might or might not be randomly tumbling and changing sizes.

The duck later became her own channel [[mascot]]. It speaks using Subaru's ASMR duck voice.

Not to be confused with the [[Subatomo (oozora subaru)|]]s, ducks representing her fanbase, who have a distinct [[Subatomo (big)|big]] and [[Subatomo (small)|small]] variation.

h4. See also

* [[Takanashi Kiara (phoenix)]]
* [[Pavolia Reine (peahen)]]
* [[Nanashi Mumei (owl)]]
* [[Takane Lui (hawk)]]
* [[Kaela Kovalskia (penguin)]]
