title: predator_(series)
body:
A [[science fiction]] action/thriller media franchise produced by [[20th century studios|20th Century Studios]]. Primarily revolves around the titular [[predator (character)|species of]] [[alien]] and their encounters with humans and other alien species who they hunted for sport.

Three more sequels were produced after the [[Predator (1987)|1987 movie of the same name]], called [i][[Predator 2]][/i] (1990), [i][[Predators (2010)|]][/i] (2010) and [i]The Predator[/i] (2018) respectively. A prequel set before the previous movies, titled [[Prey (2022 movie)|]] directed by Dan Trachtenberg, was released in 2022. Due to Prey's positive reviews, Trachtenberg would return to direct two new Predator movies, [[Predator: Killer of Killers]], an animated anthology movie, and Predator: Badlands, a live action movie set in the future, with both movies set to be released in 2025 on Hulu and theaters respectively.

Often has a crossover with the [[Alien (series)|]] franchise.

h4. See also
* [[Alien vs. Predator]]

title: tsubasa_shindo
body: Leader of UNICORN JR. . With a cheeky personality, he isn't intimidated by his seniors.

title: psycho_gundam
body:
A fictional massive variable geometry [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985. 

[b]MRX-009 Psycho Gundam[/b]

A huge variable [[Mobile Suit]] (sometines labeled a [[Mobile Armor]] due to its enormous size and the secondary configuration on which it can transform) developed by the [[Titans (gundam)|]] to be piloted by Newtypes and Cyber-Newtypes. It resembles a colossal black Gundam (due to many of its experimental equipments such as the Psycommu, which gives it its name, being still new and not yet optimized in size). It was operated primarily by [[Four Murasame]].

[spoiler]Cyber-Newtype [[Jill Ratokie]] was killed testing this mecha. The Psyco-Gundam is often referred to as an "evil machine" due to the fact that its psycommu is actually reversed in order to control the pilot and force them to fight. This technology was derived from the one used in the old [[Zeon]] [[Elmeth]] MA.[/spoiler]

Evolved into the [[Psycho Gundam Mk II]].

h4. See also

* [[Psycho Gundam Mk III]]
* [[Psycho Gundam (gquuuuuux)]] - the [[Gundam GQuuuuuuX]] counterpart

title: miyu_edelfelt_(third_ascension)
body:
[[Miyu Edelfelt]] in her Third Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This is what she looks like when she was originally part of the Sakatsuki clan, wearing her hair in multiple hair buns and a ponytail, adorned with multiple red bows and tassels. She wears a floral-print kimono, a white kimono shirt over the first kimono, a red pleated skirt, dark blue socks, and sandals. Magical Sapphire's appearance also changes from a short rod to a long staff with a hollow star at the top.

title: sylphiette_(mushoku_tensei)
body:
A female character from the novel, manga and anime series [[Mushoku Tensei]]. A beloved childhood friend of [[Rudeus Greyrat]], [spoiler]later on known under the cover identity [b]Fitts/Fitz[/b] before eventually becoming Rudeus's [[polygamy|first]] wife. She is also the granddaughter of [[Elinalise Dragonroad]][/spoiler].

She is of mixed heritage (she has elven, human and beast race ancestors), and inherited [[pointy ears]] from the former. Her hair was initially [[green hair|green]] and short, but due to the ordeal following the Teleport Catastrophe, it became [[white hair|white]] (she also let her hair grow longer).

h4. External links

* "Mushoku Tensei Wiki: Sylphiette":[https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/Sylphiette]
other_names: シルフィエット・グレイラット

title: formidable_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] aircraft carrier HMS [i]Formidable[/i]. 
Character design by [[Kincora]], voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[dress]] with white [[frilled dress|frills]] in a [[gothic_lolita|gothic lolita]] style, [[two-tone ribbon|two-tone]] [[ribbon]]s, and [[white pantyhose]]. Like her sisters, she has [[large breasts]], with her outfit showing a generous amount of [[cleavage]]. She also has [[very long hair|absurdly long]] [[grey hair]] in [[twintails]].

title: manchester_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the light cruiser HMS [i]Manchester[/i] (15). Character design by [[Dsmile]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a single [[hair bun]], [[aqua eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her default outfit is the same with the rest of the [i]Town[/i]-class except [i]Southampton[/i]: a [[maid]] uniform with [[puffy short sleeves]], [[white gloves]], and [[white thighhighs]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two of her four real-life 152 mm triple gun mounts, two 102 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]].

h4. Appearance

title: code_geass
body:
[b]Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion[/b] (コードギアス 反逆のルルーシュ [i]Kōdo Giasu: Hangyaku no Rurūshu[/i], lit. "Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion"), often referred to as simply Code Geass, is a Japanese anime series created by [[Sunrise (company)|]], directed by Gorō Taniguchi, and written by Ichirō Ōkouchi, with original character designs by manga authors [[Clamp (circle)|]].

Code Geass first ran in Japan on MBS from October 5, 2006, to July 28, 2007. Its sequel series, [b]Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion R2[/b] (コードギアス 反逆のルルーシュR2), ran as a simulcast on JNN stations (like MBS and TBS) from April 6, 2008 to September 28, 2008. The series has also been adapted into various manga and light novels with the former showing various alternate scenarios from the TV series. Bandai Entertainment also licensed most parts from the franchise for English release in December 2007, airing the two TV series on Cartoon Network. Most manga and light novels have also been published in North America by Bandai.

Set in an alternate timeline, the series focuses on how the former prince Lelouch vi Britannia obtains a power known as Geass and decides to use it to obliterate the Holy Britannian Empire, an imperial monarchy and a superpower that has been conquering various countries.

h4. Characters

title: phantom_(zelda)
body:
A recurring enemy in [[The Legend of Zelda]]. Also appears in [[Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]] during [[Princess Zelda|Princess Zelda's]] "Phantom Slash" move.

In [[The Legend of Zelda: Spirit Tracks]], Zelda's spirit can possess and take control of their bodies. When this happens, the normally eyeless helmet gains glowing pink eyes.

title: karakasa_obake
body:
An umbrella [[traditional youkai]]. It has [[one-eyed|one eye]], a long [[tongue]] and a single foot. Also known as 唐傘小僧 ([i]Karakasa Kozou[/i], Karakasa Boy).

"Karakasa" is another word for 和傘, a traditional Japanese [[oil-paper umbrella]]. The word means "Chinese-style umbrella" in Japanese because it originated in China.

h4. See also

* [[Tatara Kogasa]], one of the more famous examples.

title: might_guy
body:
[[Naruto (classic)|]] character.

He looks exactly like an adult version of [[Rock Lee]] albeit with eyes that are almost shut as an emphasis for his age. As per the other Hidden Leaf mentors, he wears a special green Hidden Leaf vest.

He is the mentor of Lee, [[Hyuuga Neji]], and [[Tenten (naruto)|]], the four of whom form Team Guy.

He is famous for his Self Rule book, in which he makes up his own rules and punishments (in case he screws the rules), and is often considered a joke character in the series.

title: hatake_kakashi
body: A supporting character in [[Naruto (classic)|]]. An elite ninja who trained [[Uzumaki Naruto]], [[Uchiha Sasuke]] and [[Haruno Sakura]]. He is the rival of [[Might Guy]] but does not seem to take him very seriously...

title: taiyou_akari_(tenebrae_mode)
body:
[[Taiyou Akari]]'s tenebrae mode ([[magical girl]]) form. 

When transformed into this state, her hair grows longer, becoming [[glowing hair|glowing]]. Her [[hair over one eye|hair also falls over right eye]], and she tends to have a more serious expression.
She uses as her weapon a [[flaming sword|flaming]] [[rapier]] that she draws from the Elemental Tarot of [[The Sun (tarot)|]].

title: chuchu's_demi_trainer
body: [[Mobile Suit]] from [[gundam_suisei_no_majo|Mobile Suit Gundam: The Witch of Mercury]]. A [[Demi Trainer]] customized for, and piloted by, [[Chuatury Panlunch]].

title: solo
body:
An image containing a single person. No one else should be visible in the image.

That means only one copy of the character. These situations [b]should not be tagged solo[/b]:

* Single characters being depicted from [[multiple views]] (post #12904)
* [[dakimakura (medium)|]] which contain [[multiple views]]
* [[dual persona]]
* [[time paradox]]
* A character alongside an animal or creature [b]with a character tag[/b] (talking or otherwise), such as post #9791130

These situations should be tagged [[solo focus]], [b]not solo[/b]:

* Pictures focusing on one character among a crowd of nondescript, less detailed [[people]].
* Single characters engaged in [[tag group:sex acts|sex acts]] with [[faceless]] or [[out of frame]] characters.

Situations that can be solo include:

* A single character with one or more inanimate [[doll]]s or [[photo_(object)|]]s of other characters.
* A single character with [b]unnamed[/b] pet or object characters. 

h4. See also

* [[1boy]]
* [[1girl]]
* [[1other]]
* [[solo focus]]

title: hibiki_(kancolle)
body:
Hibiki is 22nd Fubuki-class destroyer and/or 2nd Akatsuki-class destroyer in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i].
Character design by [[Yadokari (migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

The Akatsuki-class wears a white and dark blue [[serafuku]] with a "III" somewhere on themselves as well as some form of black legwear.

Hibiki herself has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]], [[aqua_hair|aqua]], or [[grey hair]], [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[grey eyes]], she wears [[black thighhighs]] and a [[flat cap]]. The "III" is on her hat.

title: superman
body:
A popular and iconic superhero from [[DC Comics]], and the main character of the comic series [[superman (series)|of the same name]].

The humanoid [[alien]] from Planet Krypton, sent to Earth as an infant child. His birth name is [b]Kal-El[/b], and his adoptive parents name him [[Clark Kent]]. As living under a yellow sun grants Clark immense powers, such as hypersonic flight, nigh invulnerability, super strength, heat vision, a freezing breath, hypersensitive hearing, X-ray vision, and many others, he takes up the mantle of [b]Superman[/b] - wearing a [[superhero costume]] that consists of a [[red cape]] and a [[blue bodysuit|blue]] [[bodysuit|suit]] - as he performs great heroic deeds around the Earth and in the city of Metropolis.

In many crossover media, Superman is frequently depicted as a rival of [[Batman]], primarily due to their contrasting qualities such as Superman's usage of superhuman power compared to Batman's usage of gadgets and their clashing philosophies regarding how to handle a villain.

Superman was created by the late Joe Shuster and the late Jerry Siegel and was first introduced in [i]Action Comics[/i] #1 (1938)

h4. See also

* [[Batman]]
* [[Clark Kent]]
* [[Lex Luthor]]

title: 1other
body:
An image depicting a humanoid character of ambiguous or indeterminate gender, either because their face or features are [[ambiguous gender|not visible]], they're [[androgynous]], they're a genderless being or their gender is not canonically known.

If said character is shown to display distinguishable gender traits, use [[1girl]] + [[genderswap (otf)]] or [[1boy]] + [[genderswap (otm)]] accordingly.

If the character is shown in a romantic or sexual relationship, use [[other with male]], [[other with female]], or [[other with other]] as necessary.

Do not use this for [[futanari]]/[[futa without pussy]] characters or [[animal]]s.


h4. See also:

title: triple_tiara_(umamusume)
body:
A reference to [[Umamusume]] who have taken the tiara route. In real life, it is the a triple crown for fillies (female horse) who won Oka Sho, Yushun Himba (also known as Japanese Oaks) and Shuka Sho.

Tag only applies when all or at least 3 of them are present.

h4. Members (In order)

* !post #8906025: [[Almond Eye (Umamusume)|]] (2018)
* !post #8906039: [[Daring Tact (Umamusume)|]] (2020)

title: amagi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Amagi[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[high ponytail|high]], [[wide ponytail]], [[brown eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[maple leaf|Japanese maple]] [[leaf hair ornament]] on her ponytail. 

At base form, she wears a [[floral print|floral pattern]] [[green kimono]] with a [[green sash|green]] [[obi]] bearing her real-life [[flight deck]] camouflage pattern, and carries her banner-rod wrapped on her back. Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces painted in green, bearing her real-life bridge and [[anti-aircraft gun]]s. When she is damaged, she slumps sideways, a reference to how she was sunk in real-life.

She has a high-strung, yet still "mature woman" personality, with a lack of confidence in her abilities and constant worry about air attacks.  Her depiction in doujin works tend to run more towards the "Yamato Nadeshiko" end of the spectrum, focusing upon the personality implied by her unusually ornate and formal clothing in her unremodeled state.

h4. Appearance

* !post #1920004: Base
* !post #1920007: [[Amagi Kai (kancolle)|Kai]]
* !post #2229909: [[Amagi (new year) (kancolle)|New Year]]
* !post #2520006: [[Amagi (Yukata) (Kancolle)|Yukata]]

h4. [i]Unryuu[/i]-class aircraft carriers

* [[Unryuu (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Amagi[/b]
* [[Katsuragi (Kancolle)|]]

title: kimura_kaere
body:
A major character from [[Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei]].

Kaere is a half-foreign (of unknown nationality) transfer student who recently moved back to Japan. She also suffers from dissociative identity disorder - on one hand, she is "Kaede", a "Yamato Nadeshiko"; on the other hand, she is "Kaere", a stereotypically obnoxious foreigner who threatens to sue for trivial reasons. Her personality change can be triggered by the word "帰れ" - "kaere" ("go back") - which also lends itself to her given (latter) name. Her whole name is also a reference to singer Kimura Kaela. A running gag is that she is the class's designated "[[pantyshot]] girl".

title: jugglus_juggler
body:
[b]Jugglus Juggler[/b]  also called Juggrus-Juggler in some sources, is the former villain of [[Ultraman Orb (series)|]], the main antagonist/deuteragonist of the Ultraman Orb Chronicle, and Gai Kurenai/[[Ultraman Orb]]'s partner turned archenemy turned rival. When in times of peace, he appears as a man in a dark suit, while his true form is a Majin dressed in copper armor.

He appears in [[Ultraman Z (series)|]], where he takes both supporting and antagonistic roles depending on his own agenda. In this appearance he takes on the human disguise of [spoiler][[Hebikura Shouta]][/spoiler].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8858368

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Jugglus Juggler":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Jugglus_Juggler]

title: boo_(mario)
body:
An iconic [[ghost]] enemy from the [[Mario (series)|Mario Series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]], where they were originally named "Boo Diddlys". They have a [[shy]] personality, as they will cover their face whenever someone looks at them, but will uncover and chase the player when not being looked at. Commonly found in Ghost Houses.

Boos also appear in the [[Mario Kart]] franchise as an item used to steal other items from opponents and will make the user temporary invisible and invincible. They are also playable characters in certain [[Mario Party]], [[Mario Golf]] and [[Mario Tennis]] games.

Boos are depicted as white spherical ghosts with stubby arms, [[black eyes|black]] beady eyes, [[sharp teeth]] and large [[tongue]]s.

title: nissan_gt-r
body:
Successor to the legendary [[Nissan Skyline GT-R]], the GT-R was designed as a [[car|super sportscar]] that could beat designs such as the [[Porsche 911]] on both price & performance. Built from 2007 to 2025.

Its multifunction display was designed by Polyphony Digital, creators of the [[Gran Turismo]] series.

[/tr]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Meine Nouvelle (racehorse)|]] (this makes him a younger brother to [[Meine Theresia (racehorse)|]] and thus, an uncle to [[Uberleben (racehorse)|]]).

While he started as an unfortunate runner on flat, his fortune changed when he switched to steeple-chase. He won his first race and eventually became unbeaten in 2023, culminating in his crushing victory at the 2023 Nakayama Daishogai. He thus became Gold Ship's second progeny to obtain a G1 title of some form.

Japanese racehorse from the post-war period. She is best known as a prolific broodmare, whose mare-line is still extant and active today.

She is the mare-line ancestor of [[Special Week (racehorse)|]] (her great x2-grandson), [[Matikanefukukitaru (racehorse)|]] (her great x3-grandson) and [[Vodka (racehorse)|]] (her great x4-granddaughter). In the context of [[Umamusume]], she is refered to like a Shinto deity by [[Matikanefukukitaru (umamusume)|]] as "Shiraoki-sama" and is often depicted as a look-alike of her descendant.

title: monokuma
body:
[b]Monokuma[/b] is the main antagonist of [[Danganronpa (series)|]], and serves as the mascot for the whole franchise. He is the mastermind of the "killing class" that forced his "students" to kill each other for survival.

He is a robotic [[teddy bear]] with a distinctive [[split theme|split coloring]]; the right side is white and friendly, while the left side is black and sports an [[evil grin]].

He is voiced by [[Ooyama Nobuyo]] until 2016, and by [[TARAKO (voice actor)|]] until 2024.

title: gundam_msv
body:
The [b]Mobile Suit Variations[/b], simply known as [b]MSV[/b] to fans, are variations on the mechanical designs of the [[Gundam]] franchise, particularly those of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. Most of them never appeared in animated form. They were first published in 1983 and most were created by Gundam mechanical designer [[Ookawara Kunio]].

These [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]] variations are official designs, including their own histories and in many cases their own pilots with detailed backstories. Some were cancelled or alternative designs originally created for an animated production, while others are promotional variations used as the basis for unique [[gunpla|model kits]]. 

While never seen in their own animation series, most of the MSV machines (as well as the backstories and pilots created for them) are considered canonical, and a feature in other side-stories, manga, or (mostly) in [[video game]]s.

h4. See also
* [[MSV-R: The Return Of Johnny Ridden]] 
* [[MSV-R: Legend Of The Universal Century Heroes: The Fabulous Shin Matsunaga]]

title: mexican-american_war
body:
A war between [[Mexico]] and the [[United States]] from 1846-1848 over ownership of the land in the south-western part of North America, which at the time formed the northern half of Mexico. The United States was victorious in the conflict, but the annexation of so much new territory destroyed existing compromises over the spread of slavery, which would in turn lead to the [[American Civil War]] less than 15 years later. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mexican-American War":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexican%E2%80%93American_War]

title: moo_deng
body:
A baby [[pygmy hippopotamus]] born on July 10, 2024 at the Khao Kheow Open Zoo in Sri Racha, Thailand. Her charm attracted many visitors to the zoo as well as caused her to go viral on TikTok and become an Internet meme. She has also been subject to harassment such as being splashed with water and having objects thrown at her, resulting in widespread condemnation online.

Moo Deng's widespread popularity has caused increased awareness of the pygmy hippo species, though some of the photos and clips attributed to Moo Deng are actually of other baby pygmy hippos, most notably her brother [[Moo Tun]].

h4. Reference

* !asset #23600427: [[Moo Deng]] with her mother [[Jonah (pygmy hippo)|]] behind her.

h4. See also

* [[list of real life animals]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/moo-deng-baby-hippo-sprayed-with-water]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moo_Deng]

title: dreissen
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]AMX-009 Dreissen[/b]

A high speed, heavy (but very agile) [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. Using data from the older [[Rick Dom II]] and inspired by the legendary [[Dom (mobile suit)|]] series, it performed very well using its sleeve cannons. It was [[Rakan Dahkaran]]'s first mecha of choice during The First Neo Zeon War (Gundam ZZ).

[[gundam_unicorn|During the units' tenure with the Sleeves]], many issues with the design (namely the exposed [[arm cannon]] power cables) were ironed out and they were issued beam sabers to aid in close quarters combat.

title: kyoto
body:
A city located in the central part of the island of Honshu, Japan. It has a population close to 1.5 million. Formerly the imperial capital of Japan for more than 1000 years, it is now the capital city of Kyoto Prefecture located in the Kansai region, as well as a major part of the Kyoto-[[osaka_(city)|Osaka]]-[[Kobe]] metropolitan area.

title: fukawa_toko
body:
A character introduced in [[Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc]], titled the Ultimate Writing Prodigy (超高校級の「文学少女」).

She has a gloomy and pessimistic personality, making it hard for her to get along with others, though she's obsessively in love with [[Togami Byakuya]]. [spoiler]Her alternate personality is the demented serial killer [[Genocider Shou]].[/spoiler]

Has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]] or [[brown hair]], [[purple eyes]], and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. Wears [[round eyewear|round]] glasses and a [[black serafuku|black]] or [[purple serafuku]] consisting of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], a [[red neckerchief]], and a [[long skirt]]. In her debut appearance, she has [[twin braids]], [[white socks]], and [[purple shoes|purple]] [[loafers]].

She later returns as the deuteragonist of [[Danganronpa Another Episode: Ultra Despair Girls]], accompanying protagonist [[Naegi Komaru]]. Compared to her initial design, her appearance in this game is noticeably more disheveled. Her [[torn skirt|skirt]], [[torn neckerchief|neckerchief]], and left [[torn sleeve|sleeve]] are all [[torn]], and her hair (which is now [[hair down|worn down]]) is [[messy hair|messy]]. She also has an [[ahoge]], several [[hairclip]]s, [[purple thighhighs]], and [[mary janes|Mary Jane]] [[high heels|heels]].

h4. External links
* "Danganronpa Wiki":https://danganronpa.fandom.com/wiki/Toko_Fukawa

title: paris_hilton
body: [b]Paris Whitney Hilton[/b] (born February 17, 1981) is a media personality and socialite whose a member of the billionaire Hilton family who owns the Hilton Hotels & Resorts, now led by her father, Richard Hilton. She became famous in the early 2000s when she and her friend Nicole Richie, the adopted daughter of singer Lionel Richie, appeared in the hit reality show, [b]The Simple Life[/b] (2003-2007), where Paris and Nicole try to live and work as regular people with mixed and hilarious results.

title: kujo_jotaro
body:
[b]Kujo Jotaro[/b] ([i]Kuujou Joutarou[/i]) is the main protagonist of [[Stardust Crusaders]] and supporting character of [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]] and [[Stone Ocean]] of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Grandson of Part 2's [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]]. Son of Joseph's daughter [[Kujo Holy]] and a Japanese jazz musician named [[Kujo Sadao]]. Later has a daughter named [[Kujo Jolyne]]. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Star Platinum]].

Almost invariably depicted wearing a [[long coat]] and a [[hat]] with a frayed back that seems to blend with his hair. Originally his [[school uniform]] ([[gakuran]]), all later outfits Jotaro wears are based around a long coat and his distinctive style of hat. His accessories contains [[stud earrings]], [[multiple belts]] ([[triangle print]]) and [[collar chain (jewelry)|]].

title: kimitachi_wa_dou_ikiru_ka
body:
A Japanese animated film directed by [[Miyazaki Hayao]], and animated by [[Studio Ghibli]]. The film is named after the 1937 book of the same name, written by Yoshino Genzaburo, but not based on it. Beginning production in July 2016, the film was originally anticipated for release before the original dates of the [[2020 Summer Olympics]], but even by August 2018, Studio Ghibli had already shifted their expectations ahead to 2021 or 2022. In December 2022, Studio Ghibli announced a release date of July 14, 2023, with the theatrical poster being the only piece of promotion, leading to artists making parodying fanarts of the Heron.

Later won the [[The Academy Awards|Oscar]] Best Animated Feature in 2024, 21 years after [[Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi]] achieved the same feat.

title: oathkeeper
body:

[spoiler]The Oathkeeper is formed when Sora uses Kairi's Wayfinder as a Keychain. After rescuing her from Hollow Bastion in Kingdom Hearts, Kairi gives him the charm for luck in the Secret Waterway in Traverse Town.[/Spoiler]

title: nazrin
body:
The "Little Dowser General". Stage 1 mid-boss and boss, as well as Stage 5 mid-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]].

A [[mouse girl|mouse]] youkai who can seek lost objects with her [[dowsing rod]]s, as well as the leader of a pack of [[mouse (animal)|mice]]. She is a direct subordinate of [[Toramaru Shou]], although not (until later) a follower of Shou's master [[Hijiri Byakuren]]. Doujinshi sometimes comically portray her being chased by [[Kaenbyou Rin]], [[Chen]], and/or [[Goutokuji Mike]] on account of their species. 

She has [[mouse ears]] and a [[mouse tail]] with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit is a [[grey vest]] [[skirt set|and]] [[grey skirt]] with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], sometimes a [[grey capelet]], a [[necklace]] with a [[crystal]] [[pendant]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. Her mouse is usually in a [[holding basket|basket]] [[holding with tail|on her tail]].

h4. Appearance

body:
[i]Guard operator Viviana, once known as the Candle Knight.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Viviana Droste von Hochberg

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Leithanien[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 21[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Elafia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]171 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]8 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Also known by her knight title [b]The Candle Knight[/b].

NPC and stage mini-boss introduced as part of event [i]Near Light[/i]. Formerly a noble of Leithania, she's a rising star Grand Knight of Kazimierz who wields a [[candlestand|chamberstick]] in battle. During Near Light, she meets and later faces off against [[Nearl (Arknights)|]], but concedes defeat.

Introduced as a playable character in the side-story [i]Zwillingstürme Im Herbst[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Ichimichi Mao|M·A·O]] (Japanese), Qin Ziyi (Chinese), Lena Tiemann (English and German), and Lee Seul (Korean). Her art designer is [[Chuzenji]].

title: liliana_canistrelli
body:
Daughter of a multi-millionaire. Her father organised the yacht charter as a means to remove the bustling distractions of the mainland, allowing his daughter to focus on her college studies. 

Lili's an aspiring social influencer who enjoys high fashion, dining and drinking responsibly until she throws up. 

Original Character created by [[louis lloyd-judson]]

title: andoain_(arknights)
body:
Former Pontifica Cohors squadmate and captain of [[Mostima (Arknights)|]], [[Fiammetta (Arknights)|]] and [[Lemuen (arknights)|]], before the squad was disbanded due to a certain incident.

[spoiler]During the squad's last mission, the four discovered an ancient relic in Kazdel. Fiammetta and Mostima left to search other nearby places while Andoain and Lemuen went to check the relic. Being an Iberian born Sankta who experienced his hometown and everyone he knows cease to exist, Andoain has been desperate to find a way to save the other races suffering outside of Laterano. When he touched the relic, it showed him the scene when the first Teekaz became Sankta. Not knowing this hidden history of the Sankta, he mistook it as a prophecy of the future, where even the filthiest monsters can become angels. Realizing that the images are starting to fade, Andoain maximized his originium arts to see clearer so he can know how to reach this "future", but he lost control and caused a massive explosion. Mostima came back at this exact moment and shot him to stop him, which caused her to fall, while Lemuen fell into a coma.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !post #9791678: Priest (Guide Ahead)
* !post #9802217: Pontifica Cohors (The Masses' Travels)
* !post #9802215: Nursery Basilica (The Masses' Travels)
* !post #9781961: [[andoain (young) (arknights)|Young]] (The Masses' Travels)

She was a member of Kazdel Military Commission until she defected to Babel and become an intelligence officer, 
after the fall of Babel, she joined Rhodes Island and become a leader of Special Warrant Extermination and Elimination Protocol (S.W.E.E.P.), one of Rhodes Island's branch.

She mae a short appearance in [i]Vigilo[/i], before she made a proper appearance in [i]Episode 10: Shatterpoint[/i], and become playable in the event [i]Babel[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are Nagasawa Miki (JP), Xu Hui (CN), Ali Hillis (EN), and Lee Serena (KR). Her illustrator is [[Cenm0]].

title: yomotsu_hisami
body: Beautiful Stalker of Hell First appeared in [[Touhou]] 19: [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]] as a boss and playable character. Hisami is a yomotsu-shikome who works directly under [[Nippaku Zanmu]]. Her job is to welcome people into Hell, from which they can never escape her grasp. It is stated that she does her job by offering people a cut of her payment, the amount of which is based on how many people she dragged to hell, and she gave the people she brought to hell the money she promised them. This method resulted in the people she dragged to hell to not hate her and making [[shiki eiki|the Yama]] question if she did her job too well. In the events of UDoALG, she mainly acts as Zanmu's confidant, though she occasionally disobeys her orders in an attempt to make Zanmu mad. Due to her omake profile describing her relationship with Zanmu, alongside some choice dialogue (including panting in front of her and asking [[ibuki suika|Suika]] how to make Zanmu look at her) coupled with her one-track obsession with making Zanmu scold her, fans have taken to depicting her as a [[yuri|lesbian]] [[masochism|masochist]]. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Hisami Yomotsu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hisami_Yomotsu

title: executor_(arknights)
body:
[i]Executor, a professional undertaker sent from the Laterano Embassy, is glad to fulfill any and all contracts[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Federico Giallo

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sankta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]181 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A lawyer from the Laterano Notarial Hall, he came to Rhodes Island along with [[Vermeil_(arknights)|Vermeil]] in order to fulfill his client's last wish to give Vermeil treatment for her oripathy. He himself has been contracted to Rhodes Island, where he executes functions related to the rights of Laterano citizens. His main weapon is a shotgun, most likely based on a [[Winchester Model 1887]].

Due to the way he speaks and his behavior, many of his colleagues are convinced he is just a robot disguised as a living person.

As a Sankta, his motif is an angel. He has a black halo above his head and crystallized black "wings" coming out of his back.

He is voiced by [[Kondou Takashi]].

title: tony_tony_chopper
body:
One of the main protagonists of the manga and anime [[One Piece]]
He is the ship's doctor of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]].
His life goal is to cure all known diseases in order to honor his late foster father, Dr. Hiriluk.

He is a [[reindeer]] capable of human speech and understanding due to the [i]Hito Hito no Mi[/i] [[Devil Fruit]] he consumed, and is also capable of transforming into a more muscular version of himself for combat.

body:

Leader of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1 and a skilled spear user. She, [[Beagle (Arknights)|]], and [[Kroos (Arknights)|]] left Columbia for Rhodes Island after being infected with Oripathy and were discriminated because of their illness.

Has impulsive tendencies and appears to be somewhat envious of her teammate [[Lava (arknights)|]] because of the abilities she acquired from contacting Oripathy. Despite her shortcomings, she constantly works hard to lead her team to glory.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Shiraishi Ryouko]] (Japanese), Chen Yanyi (Chinese), Norma Butikofer (English), and Kim Ha-ru (Korean). Her art designer is [[Xiayehongming]].

body:

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]

The defender of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1. She used to be a Columbian police cadet, alongside [[Fang (arknights)|]] and [[Kroos (arknights)|]].

Despite her clumsiness and immaturity in some respects, she displays professionalism, resilience and extreme talent. 

She likes to help other R.I. operators and her teammates, such as solving disputes between [[Lava (arknights)|]] and [[Hibiscus (arknights)|]], or helping Fang to find Kroos.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Nana Harumura (JP), Wang Xiaotong (CN), Claire Morgan (EN) and Lee Hyun-jin (KR). Her illustrator is [[Xiayehongming]].

title: bar_phone
body:
Form factor of [[cellphone]] from the late 1990s and early 2000s, also known as a monoblock or candybar phone. Characterized by having the keypad, navigation buttons, and screen on a single flat surface. Not to be confused with the larger [[brick phone]]s of the 1980s.

[[Flip phone]]s separate the screen and buttons on two halves of a clamshell design. [[Slide phone]]s conceal the keypad on a separate retractable layer. [[Smartphone]]s have no physical keypad.

h4. Examples

* !post #8178674
* !post #8182883

h4.See also
* [[cellphone]]
* [[Nokia 3310]]

Born in Londinium in Victoria, Lava is the younger twin sister of her fellow Operator, [[Hibiscus (Arknights)|]]. After contracting Oripathy, she came to Rhodes Island for treatment. She found the idea of saving lives appealing, and so volunteered for training. Lava is tough and ignores the advice of others when she moves into action. She is gentle and childlike at heart but prefers not to admit it to herself. Whenever anyone brings this up, she immediately changes the subject and tries to play it cool.

Member of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1, along with [[Fang (Arknights)|]], [[Beagle (Arknights)|]], [[Kroos (Arknights)|]] and her older sister, Hibiscus.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Mizuhashi Kaori]].

title: dissidia_final_fantasy
body:
Crossover fighting game of the [[Final Fantasy]] JRPG series for the [[PlayStation Portable]] developed and published by [[Square Enix]].

A sequel/prequel, [i][[Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy]][/i], was released in March 2011. A team-vs-team spinoff, [i][[Dissidia Final Fantasy NT]][/i], first developed in arcades in 2015, was later ported to [[PlayStation 4]] and Steam (platform). A tie-in [i]gachapon[/i] RPG, [i][[Dissidia Final Fantasy Opera Omnia]][/i], was released concurrently, and still receives updates and new characters.

h4. Fighting for [[Cosmos (dff)|]]

title: dissidia_final_fantasy_nt
body:
A spinoff of [[Dissidia Final Fantasy]]. First developed in arcades in 2015 and later ported to [[PlayStation 4]] and Steam.

h4. Characters

title: chaos_marie_(grimms_notes)
body:
An event boss from [[Grimms Notes]]. She is the antagonist of the symbol collection event [i]The End of the Olden Days[/i], and became a playable Healer a year later.

A younger, magical girl version of Marie Antoinette. Her desire to be loved by her people turned her into a Chaos Teller. With her powers, she supplies unlimited food to save her nation from hunger and poverty.

Her [[voice actor]] is Miyamoto Kanako. Her art designer is [[Kyoka Hatori]]. 

A common [[artistic error]] is coloring the skin exposed by the [[cleavage cutout]] of her shirt in a different shade, as though it were part of her clothing.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25771339
other_names: カオス・マリー(グリムノーツ)

title: cowbell
body:
A typically rectangular [[bell]] used on [[neck bell]]s for livestock, such [[cow|cattle]] or [[sheep]], or more frequently in anime, [[cow girl]]s and [[cow boy]]s.

Cowbells are also be used as a percussion [[instrument]]. Cowbells emit a dull, metallic tone when struck.

h4. See also

title: helesta_armor
body:
A small [[mecha]] for [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Lize Helesta]], a parody of and rival to [[Hanabatake Chaika]]'s [[Hanabatake Chaika (5th Costume)|Chaika Amor]].

Originally designed unofficially by [[Chaki (Teasets)|]] as a joke. When the official Nijisanji Twitter account previewed the Chaika Armor by posting its silhouette without saying whose costume it would be, Chaki drew the Helesta Armor to match its outline as an obviously incorrect prediction. Lize then appeared piloting it in Chaika's costume reveal stream.

It is mostly white with [[glowing eyes]] and a [[glass cockpit]] in its chest. Lize wears a [[blue bodysuit|blue]] [[mecha pilot suit]] with an [[electric plug tail]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9856860: Helesta Armor
* !post #9856862: Pilot suit

h4. External links

* "Origin":[https://x.com/chakichakichaki/status/1247351514231746561]
* "Chaika Armor debut stream":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1oLcUmDNNI8]
* "Chaika Armor silhouette preview":[https://x.com/nijisanji_app/status/1247056710117687296]

title: lariat_(necklace)
body:
A type of [[necklace]] where another chain extends off the main necklace, forming a "Y" shape. A [[pendant]] is often hung from this extra chain.

They are often layered with other necklaces, as they are frequently made with thin material.

h4. Examples 
!post #656812
!post #4958013

h4. See also

* [[rosary]]

title: plastron_(necklace)
body:
A large [[necklace]] that hangs down from the neck to the chest and covers most of the area, usually made of precious [[gem]]s or metals. It either consists of several rows of beads and gems, or metal plates on which gems were already fixed. It originated from Egypt’s [[usekh collar]]. 

The name plastron, coming from the French language, meant “bib”.

h4. Examples 
!post #8442505
!post #8578312

title: festoon_(necklace)
body:
A type of [[necklace]] featuring a decorative arrangement of [[gem]]s draped from the main necklace. It is named for festoon garlands, which have a similar draping shape.

h4. Examples 
!post #2180957
!post #9195809

title: reisen_udongein_inaba
body:
The "Lunatic [[Moon Rabbit]]". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]] and later a recurring playable character in games.

Pet lunar [[rabbit girl|rabbit]] of [[Houraisan Kaguya]], apprentice to [[Yagokoro Eirin]], and caretaker of earth-born rabbit youkai [[Inaba Tewi]]. Her power is to cause lunacy with her stare, as well as control all kinds of wavelengths. Ironically, Reisen is also depicted as one of the more level-headed characters of the series. Doujins make fun of her danmaku, which vaguely resemble suppositories, as well as her rabbit ears, which look as though they were buttoned onto her head. In [[Urban Legend in Limbo]], her urban legend was the [[Kune-kune]].

She has [[red eyes]], [[rabbit ears]] and a [[rabbit tail]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]]. She is one of the few Touhou characters with a "normal" outfit, with a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] over a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] [[collared shirt|with]] a [[red necktie]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[pink skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. There might be a [[crescent pin]] or a [[carrot pin]] somewhere on her clothing.
 
h4. Appearance
* !post #7885194: Profile
* !post #2789206: [[Urban Legend in Limbo]]
* !post #2475808: [[Forbidden Scrollery]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Reisen Udongein Inaba":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Reisen_Udongein_Inaba
other_names: 鈴仙・優曇華院・イナバ

title: riviere_(necklace)
body:
Type of [[necklace]] made of multiple [[gem]]s of [i]similar color and cut[/i] strung together. The stones are either all the same size, or gradually increase in size towards the middle of the necklace, and there may sometimes be [[pendant]] gems hanging off the main necklace. 

The name refers to the French word for "river", because the stones are thought to ‘flow’ around the neck.  

h4. Examples 
!post #9101123: Collier de la Reine - example of a very elaborate early rivière.
!post #3219484

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Rivière":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rivi%C3%A8re_(jewellery)

title: amiya_(guard)_(arknights)
body:
One of operator [[Amiya (Arknights)|Amiya]]'s alternate forms.


She gained such form near the end of [i]Chapter 8: Roaring Flare[/i], [spoiler]during the fight alongside Ch'en against [[Talulah (Arknights)|]].[/spoiler]

As a Guard operator, she wields a sword identical to [[Ch'en (Arknights)|Ch'en's]] Chi Xiao, and her second skill is essentially Ch'en's [[ch'en (elite ii) (arknights)|second promotion]] skill with some alterations.

Her original art designer is [[yui (niikyouzou)]], while her [b]Touch the Stars[/b] outfit is drawn by [[mag (mag42)|mag42]].

title: vicente_(tower_of_god)
body:
Arie Vicente (비센테, Bisente) is a Regular from the Arie Family and one of the siblings, as well as the strongest childhood rival of [[Hoaqin]].

Vicente has child-like appearance with youthful features and a short stature, although he is a lot less androgynous than his brother Hoaqin. He is extremely [[pale skin | pale]], with short [[white hair | silvery-white hair]], [[white eyes | silver-coloured eyes]] and [[red eyeliner | crimson lines]] underneath his eyes. Vicente wears a [[white shirt]] with a special [[brooch]] and light [[brown shorts]]. He carries a [[book]] that has a pentagram on the cover around with him.

title: novick
body:
Novick (노빅, "Nobic") is a Regular and a Spear Bearer originating from one of the Ha Family's branches.

Novick is a tall, muscular man easily over 2 metres tall, with a [[pale skin | pale complexion]] and [[black hair]]. He is often seen wearing a black, short-sleeved [[sportswear | sports shirt]]  with a [[green collar]], [[black shorts]], and black and green [[sneakers]]. He has [[red eyes]] similar to [[ Ha Yuri Zahard | Yuri]], though he has [[white pupils]].

title: khun_ran
body:
Khun Ran is a D-Rank Regular from the Khun Family who is currently climbing the Tower. He is a direct descendant of Khun Eduan and a younger brother of [[Khun Maschenny Zahard]], a Zahard's Princesses and the Top 100 High Rankers.

Ran is a short boy with light [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He almost always wears a dark blue [[T-shirt]] over a [[black shirt | black long shirt]] with [[black pants]]. His age is unknown; however, he does appear quite young.

title: lo_po_bia_yasratcha
body:
Lo Po Bia Yasratcha (로 포 비아 야스라챠, Lo Po Bia Yaseulachya) was a High Ranker from Lo Po Bia Family who holds a high military rank in Zahard's Army as the "Corps Commander" of the 5th Army Corp. 

Yasratcha has [[pale skin]] with long dark [[blue hair]], from which two brown [[cat ears]] emerge and he has a long leopard's tail. Yasratcha eyes consist of a narrow [[red pupil]] surrounded by a layer of blue and then green, with two spikes on either side of the iris. His eyes were often called like watermelon eyes, wearing a [[white robe]].

title: dowon
body:
Dowon (도원, Dowon) is a war hero from the Land of the Peach Blossom or "Dohwa" for short, one of The Five Flower Nation or Kingdom who opposed the coronation of Zahard as the King of the Tower during the Age of Genesis.

Dowon has [[pale skin]] and long flowing [[pink hair]] which fades to white. She has [[pink eyes]] with [[white pupils]] and blue beauty marks underneath both of her eyes. Her [[pointy ears | ears are pointed]] and elf-like. Her attire consists of a bright pink [[strapless dress]] , which glows at the bottom, almost like her dress is made out of Shinsu. She has a blue hair tie and blue waist tie.

title: kang_horyang
body:
Kang Horyang (강호량, Gahng Horyahng; "Kang Horyang"), formerly known as Beniamino Ilmar (베니아미노 일마르, Beniamino Ilmaleu), is one of the first Human experiment subjects of The Workshop in order to create Living Ignition Weapon.

He is a massive, brooding man with a strange mark floating above his right shoulder which under normal circumstances makes him look like a [[single wing |one-winged]] angel. His upper body and possibly lower body seems to be wrapped in black [[bandages]], which have buttons, wearing a brown [[fur-trimmed coat]].

title: nen_neya
body:
Nen Neya (넨 네야, Nen Neya) is a Beastkin who carries an unknown blood. She is the biological mother of [[Baylord Yama]] and the foster mother of [[Baylord Doom]] and [[Baylord Paul]].

Nen Neya is a humanoid female that has [[red hair]] with [[streaked hair | yellow highlights]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She has a white [[single horn | single horn]] growing out the middle of her forehead and a pair of small upright "[[animal ears | canine-like ears]]" (she is not Canines), similar to [[Baylord Yama]]. She also has a red tail similar to [[Baylord Wang Wang]]'s blue tail.

title: adori_zahard
body:
Arie Adori Zahard (아리에 아도리 자하드, Arieh Ahdoree Jahad, Arieh Adoree Jahad) is currently the strongest active Princess in the Tower. She is the Commander-in-Chief of Zahard's Army as well as the captain of Zahard's Royal Guards.

She wields the only S-rank weapon of the 13 Month Series, the Golden November.

Like many members of her family, Adori has [[white hair]] and [[white eyes]].

Based on the lore, Adori is known to be very quiet and cool-headed. Because she has little care for worldly matters, she often lies down alone and gets lost in her own fantasies. However, as there are many secrets to her private life, no one really knows the true Adori. But it is widely known to any of her fans that she will allow a person she likes to call her by her birth name.

title: po_bidau_tiara
body:
Po Bidau Tiara (포 비더 티아라, Po Bidder Tiala) is a high Ranker and a former Princess Candidate from the Po Bidau Family. She was introduced by [[Po Bidau Gustang]] to [[Khun Aguero Agnis]] as part of small strike team to infiltrate the Lo Po Bia Family Mothership in order to rescue [[Twenty-Fifth Bam]] . She is a Gustang's Writing and received her Family Leader's 'creativity'.

Tiara is a light skinned female with long [[blonde hair]] and [[glasses]]. She wears a long [[white dress]] and carry a [[book]] in her arm. She has the typical nerdy look or female book worm appearance.

title: david_hockney
body: Hockney is said to be a boy with mysterious eyes with remarkable abilities. He has [[pale skin | light grey skin]]and silver [[short hair]]. He has a [[blue robe]] with white [[fur trim]] on the edge of the hood with colourful sleeves. He carries a long pole with a lantern attached to the top. Inside the lantern on the bottom is a sculpture of a fish head.

title: augusgus
body:
Augusgus (아우구스구스) is a High Ranker and Test Director in charge of the 20th Floor. He is also a member of FUG.

Augusgus is an extremely [[pale skin | pale-skinned]] man with curly [[white hair]] and strange coloured eyes: his [[red sclera | sclera are mostly red]]  and his [[ yellow eyes | irises are yellow]]. He was seen wearing a white admirals coat over a dark grey top and dark-coloured trousers. He wears a "Fried" tag on his left arm.

title: anak_zahard
body:
Anak Zahard Jr. (아낙 자하드 Jr., "Anak Jahad Jr.") is one of Zahard's Princesses and the daughter of the real Anak Zahard who was impregnated by her lover and ran into hiding. Though she is only a demi-Princess because of her diluted Zahard's blood, she used to possess two of the 13 Month Series at one point; something only a few Princesses have accomplished.

Anak is a [[green skin | green-skinned]], slightly [[reptile girl | lizard-like girl]] (though a bit [[tomboy | tomboyish]]), with medium [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She also has a noticeable [[lizard tail | tail]], commonly exploited to call her a "lizard". She tends to wear an orange and black [[dress]], which is fairly loose to allow movement in combat.

title: houshou_marine_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]].

It consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[pirate hat|pirate]] [[bicorne]], a [[black coat]] (which she wears [[off shoulder]] most of the time), a [[cropped jacket|cropped]], [[sleeveless jacket|sleeveless]] [[red jacket]] with golden [[buttons]], [[gold trim]] adorned with a [[lapel pin]] in the shape of a pirate ship, [[leotard under clothes|worn over]] a [[see-through leotard]] with a [[black choker|black]] [[frilled choker]] or [[frilled shirt collar|collar]], a [[red ascot]] with a [[brooch]] on it, a [[red skirt|red]] and white [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], a [[brown belt|brown]] [[leather belt]], [[white gloves]], [[black thighhighs|black]] or [[brown thighhighs|brown]] [[lace-trimmed thighhighs]] and [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[brown boots|brown]] [[leather boots|leather]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[ankle boots]].

h4. Appearance

title: khun_aguero_agnis
body:
Khun Aguero Agnes (쿤 아게로 아그니스, Khun Ahgehro Ageunis; or "Kun Agero Agnis" or "Khun Aguero Agnes"), often referred to simply as "Khun", is a C-Rank Regular from Khun Family. He is a best friend of [[Twenty-Fifth Bam]], one of the main protagonists of [[Tower of God]].

His appearance was changing with story, see some changes below:

Part I:

Khun's bangs are more side sweep, and his eyes are more ultramarine than cobalt [[blue eyes]]. His hair is notably shorter and sticks out more than the second half. He wears a [[blue bandana]] tucked inside his hair. (It is occasionally used to tie up his hair. In the Crown Game arc, he used it as a signal for assistance.) He wears a [[white shirt]], [[black necktie]] and carries Manbarondenna, a special [[briefcase]]. He sometimes wears [[earrings]]. In the beginning his features used to be skinny and his face used to be angular, but this was changed sometime around the Rest arc.

Part II:

In Part II, Khun was introduced with a Safari get-up and [[shorts]]. His hair was also aquamarine, something that was corrected in the next chapter. His eyes were desaturated to a lighter blue than before, and can even be seen as electric blue in certain chapters. His clothes are inconsistent and vary with each arc. Sometimes he wears a [[shirt]], like in the Floor of Test, and sometimes he wears [[T-shirt]]. In the Devil of the Right Arm arc he wore a [[brown cloak]] with his father's armour underneath.

Part III:

In Part III, Khun is seen wearing a small [[braid]] in his hair, tucked behind his ear.

title: clownpiece
body:
[[Touhou]] character introduced as the stage five boss in [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. Later appeared as a prominent character in the manga [i]Visionary Fairies in Shrine[/i]. A Hell fairy and subordinate of [[Hecatia Lapislazuli]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[pink eyes]], and wears a [[pink hat|pink]] [[polka dot hat|polka-dot]] [[jester cap]] and [[American flag]]-[[star print|themed]] clothes with a [[neck ruff]]. It depends on artist, but it can be an [[american flag dress|american flag]] [[striped dress|dress]] or [[american flag shirt|american flag]] [[striped shirt|shirt]] with [[american flag legwear|flag]] [[striped pantyhose|pantyhose]]/[[striped leggings|leggings]]/[[american flag pants|pa]][[striped pants|nts]] and usually [[no shoes]]. She has [[fairy wings]] and she also [[holding torch|carries a torch]] with her.

According to ZUN, she's specifically a "Lampad":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lampad, a kind of underworld nymph who can drive people to madness and are companions of the Greek goddess Hecate, on whom Hecatia is based.

title: taisa_(cookie)
body:
Director of the [[Cookie (Touhou)|Cookie☆☆ trilogy]] , voicing [[Patchouli Knowledge]], [[Alice Margatroid]], [[Yakumo Yukari]], and [[Yagokoro Eirin]] but mostly appears in fan art as Patchouli or Alice. Almost always drawn [[smoking]] a [[cigarette]] and with [[sharp teeth]] across all her appearances. Never wears a hat as Patchouli, a [[collared capelet]] and no frills as Alice. Rarely associated with [[tentacles]] too.

Known for being [[yuri|in a relationship]] with [[Mars (Cookie)|]] after they met at voice acting school. Usually drawn as [[flat chest|flat]] compared to Mars. In fanworks, she appears as an unscrupulous yet charismatic director who is willing to sell the voice actors for fame.

title: children's_day
body:
[b]Children's Day[/b] is a holiday, celebrated on June 1 in many countries and on May 5 in Japan.

This tag applies to the International Children's Day (listed below), for the Japanese holiday see [[kodomo no hi]].

* International Children's Day (June 1) (Japanese: 国際子供の日/Chinese: 六一国际儿童节/六一國際兒童節)
* Universal Children's Day/World Children's Day (November 20) (Japanese: 世界こどもの日)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Children%27s_Day

title: qixi_festival
body:
[quote]Literal meaning "[i]Evening of Sevens[/i]"[/quote]
A traditional Chinese festival that is celebrated on the seventh day of the seventh month of the Chinese lunisolar calendar. The festival is celebrated to commemorate the tale of love from Chinese mythology between "a weaver girl, Zhinü, and a cowherd, Niulang":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Cowherd_and_the_Weaver_Girl. Also called [i]the Double Seventh Festival[/i], [i]the Night of Sevens[/i], [i]the Magpie Festival[/i], or [i]the Chinese Valentine's Day[/i] (one of many, alongside [[Lantern Festival]], actual [[Valentine]]'s Day, 5/20, birthdays, anniversaries, [[Christmas]], [[Thanksgiving]], [[Children's Day]], and [[Women's Day]]).

Qixi inspired [[Tanabata]], the Japanese equivalent written the same way. Despite the writing, the terms should not be used interchangeably. When Qixi made its way to Japan, other local traditions were incorporated into the festival. Notably hanging [[tanzaku]] on bamboos. Qixi applies strictly to the traditional Chinese version and Tananata strictly the Japanese version. 

h4. See also

* [[Tanabata]]
* [[Chinese New Year]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Qixi Festival":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qixi_Festival

It consists of a [[red kimono|red]] [[furisode]] with [[camellia print]]; a layered [[green sash|green]] [[obi]] with an [[orange sash|orange]] and [[yellow sash|yellow]] one underneath tied into a large [[back bow]], with a red and white [[obijime]]; alongside [[white socks]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[zouri]].

title: noel_levine
body:
A playable character in [[Witch's Heart]]. His route is the final to be unlocked, named [i]"Fantasy Space"[/i]

A gentle and polite but mysterious young man who appears at the hall of the mansion to hide from the rain - as he claims - and gets trapped together with others. Due to his erratic job schedule, he usually sleeps in his room the whole morning and only appears at night.  He apparently knows Sirius since childhood, though the latter can’t recognize him at first.

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[hair over one eye]] and [[antenna hair]]. His outfit consists of [[white shirt|white]] [[center frills]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue jacket]], [[black pants]], [[brown footwear]] and [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[neck ribbon]]. His default weapon is [[knife]]. His special ability is "seeing things others can’t".

He has a [[trap]] [[noel_levine_(past)|past form]].

title: leotard
body:
A [[skin tight]], one-piece [[bodysuit]] that covers the torso but leaves the legs free. They are usually [[sleeveless]]. They usually have a very simple design (often even just a single color), and are typically made of light fabrics to accommodate athletic activities. They are most often worn by acrobats, [[gymnastics|gymnasts]], [[dancer]]s, and circus performers.

They also influenced the [[one-piece swimsuit]] design, but swimsuits should not be tagged as leotards.

If the leotard does cover at least the upper legs, do not use this tag. Use [[bodysuit]] instead.

title: ushiromiya_lion
body:
Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. 

Lion is the 19-year-old [[androgynous]] child of [[ushiromiya krauss|Krauss]] and [[ushiromiya natsuhi| Natsuhi]], and older sibling of [[ushiromiya jessica|Jessica]] who only exists in an alternate world shown in [i]Requiem of the golden witch[/i]. Lion is the first in line of succession to the headship of the Ushiromiya family. Teams up with [[Willard H. Wright]] to solve the mystery set down by [[frederica bernkastel|Bernkastel]].

[spoiler][[Frederica bernkastel|Bernkastel]] has stated that Lion's existence is an almost impossible chance; in every other timeline, Natsuhi shoved an infant Lion and the servant carrying him off a cliff. Even though he survived, various other circumstances in the other timelines resulted in the character [[yasu (umineko)|Sayo Yasuda]].[/spoiler]

It has been all but been confirmed that Lion's true gender is "male":[http://umineko.wikia.com/wiki/Lion_Ushiromiya#Trivia], making them a [[bishounen]] and/or [[trap]].

title: selfcest
body:
A picture depicting a romantic and/or sexual relationship between either two different versions or copies of the same character. Most commonly encountered between a character and his/her [[genderswap]]ped counterpart, or between [[dual persona]]e. 

Please take care not to label identical [[twins]] in this way; the tag in that case is [[twincest]].

For non-sexual self-admiration, use [[narcissism]].

title: multiple_persona
body: Similar to [[dual persona]], except that there at least three personas of the same character involved. Take note that the [[solo]] tag, or singular people counters ([[1boy]], [[1girl]], [[1other]]) should [b]not[/b] be used with this tag. If the instances of the character are identical, use [[clone]] instead. Also see [[time paradox]] and [[multiple expressions]]. Do not use the tag for [[reference sheet]], [[variations]] and other depictions of the same character from different points of view (unless those are really different personae as in post #1173905). h4. See also * [[clone harem]] * [[selfcest]] * [[time paradox]]

title: thomas_the_tank_engine_(series)
body:
A popular British children's show based on [i]The Railway Series[/i] books by Rev. Wilbert Awdry and his son Christopher Awdry, first published in 1945. In the mid-1980s, the series was adapted as a TV Series using model trains, but then animated with CGI starting in 2009 and lasting until 2021.

Became a recurring [[meme]] after its inclusion into [[MLG]] in 2014.

title: honolulu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Honolulu[/i] (CL-48). Character design by [[Ugume]], and voiced by Yuki Yagi.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied in [[twin drills]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[large breasts]]. She wears a stylized [[military uniform]] composed of a [[crop top]] which exposes the underside of her breasts, a [[sleeveless dress|sleevess]] [[blue_dress|blue]] [[pleated dress]] and a white [[overskirt]] as well as [[black thighhighs]] and [[rudder_footwear|rudder boots]].  Her [[rigging]] consists of her twin [[smokestack]]s at her back and [[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s at her sides.

Her voice lines give her the impression of being a non-native Hawaii resident who greets and blurts out phrases in the "Hawaiian language":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaiian_language] and has immersed herself somewhat in the culture of the Hawaiian archipelago.

The historical USS [i]Honolulu[/i] served in the attack on Pearl Harbor, Battle of Tassafaronga, the Battle of Kula Gulf, the Battle of Kolombangara and the Battle of Peleliu. She was taken out of action by serious torpedo damage just before the Battle of Leyte Gulf. She was repaired, but not in time to rejoin the war. She was decommissioned in 1947 and was held in reserve until she was scrapped in 1959, by which time, her namesake city had become the capital of the 50th state to join the Union.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4533824: Base

title: white_lily_cookie
body:
A character from [[Cookie Run]]. Known as "Saint Lily Cookie" in the original Korean text.

She debuted in [[Cookie Run: Kingdom|Kingdom]] on January 21st, 2021, and became playable on January 19th, 2024.

She is one of the five Ancient Heroes. [spoiler]She is an offshoot identity of [[Dark Enchantress Cookie]].[/spoiler]

h4. Costumes

[b][[Cookie Run: Kingdom|Kingdom]][/b]
* [[White Lily Cookie (Moonflower Faerie)|Moonflower Faerie]]

h4. Appearance
* !asset #31618135: Default
* !asset #31618042: [[White Lily Cookie (Moonflower Faerie)|Moonflower Faerie]]

h4. See also
* [[List of Cookie Run characters]]
other_names: セイントリリークッキー

h4#about. About

title: mecha
body:
[b]Mecha[/b] (メカ - [i]me-ka[/i]) are giant [[robot]]s, robot vehicles, robot construction equipment, robot mobile buildings and generally over-sized robot machines. While the original Japanese definition extends to include power armor, exoskeletons, and general sci-fi machinery, for danbooru purposes this tag is for piloted and/or giant robots.

Primarily seen in [[science fiction]] settings, though there are several cases of them in [[fantasy]] settings.

h4. Types of Mecha
* [[Externally piloted mecha]] - A mecha where the controls are external and the pilot rides on top of the machine.
* [[Walker (robot)|]] - A type of walking mecha that usually lacks arms.
* [[Super Robot]] - Mecha with super powers. 
* "Real Robot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha_anime_and_manga#Real_robot (リアルロボット [i]Riaru Robotto[/i]) anime genre started by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]'s [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] in the late [[1970s_(Style)|70s]] and early [[1980s_(style)|80s]]. [[Realistic]] manned mecha similar in function to a humanoid bipedal [[tank]].

h4. Series-specific Tags
* [[Arm Slave (mecha)|]] ([[Full Metal Panic!]])
* [[Armored Trooper]] ([[Soukou Kihei VOTOMS]])
* [[AT-AT]] ([[Star Wars]])
* [[Destroid]] ([[Macross]])
* [[Dreadnought (warhammer 40k)|]] ([[Warhammer 40K]])
* [[Battroid]] ([[Macross]])
* [[Gerwalk]] ([[Macross]])
* [[Evangelion (mecha)|]] ([[Neon Genesis Evangelion]])
* [[Ferronis (xenoblade)|]] ([[Xenoblade Chronicles 3]])
* [[Gekko (metal_gear)|]] ([[Metal Gear (series)|]])
* [[Gothicmade (mecha)|]] ([[Hana no Utame Gothicmade]])
* [[Holon (gen lock)|]] ([[gen lock|Gen:Lock]])
* [[Jaeger (pacific rim)|]] ([[Pacific Rim]])
* [[Kataphrakt (aldnoah.zero)|]] ([[ALDNOAH.ZERO]])
* [[Knightmare Frame]] ([[Code Geass]])
* [[Laputa Robot]] ([[Tenkuu no Shiro Laputa]])
* [[Mashin]] ([[Magic Knight Rayearth]])
* [[Meka (overwatch)|]] ([[Overwatch]])
* [[Metal Gear (robot)|]] ([[Metal Gear (series)|]])
* [[Mobile Suit]] ([[Gundam]])
** [[Man Machine]] ([[Gaia Gear]])
** [[Mobile Armor]] ([[Gundam]])
* [[Morito (sidonia_no_kishi)|]] ([[Sidonia no Kishi]])
* [[Mortar Headd]] ([[Five Star Stories]])
* [[Orbital Frame (zone Of The Enders)|]] ([[Zone of the Enders]])
* [[Skell (xenoblade_x)|]] ([[Xenoblade Chronicles X]]) 
* [[Tactical Surface Fighter]] ([[Muv-Luv Alternative]])
* [[The Iron Giant (Mecha)]] ([[The iron Giant]])
* [[Titan (titanfall)|]] ([[Titanfall (series)|]])
* [[Variable Fighter]] ([[Macross]])


h4. Other Related tags

* [[Exoskeleton]] - Small, external mechanical attachments that tends to be worn rather than piloted. Some may qualify for the mecha tag, though it should be judged on a case by case basis.
* [[Power armor]] - Full body mechanical armor that usually augments the wearer's abilities.
* [[Robot animal]] - Robot in the shape of an animal, sometimes overlaps with mecha in series such as [[Zoids]] and certain [[Super Sentai]] entries.
* [[Robot dragon]] - Robot in the shape of a dragon, often overlaps with mecha due to their size.

h4. See also

* [[Buchi Holes]]
* [[Gerwalk]]
* [[Gunpla]]
* [[Mecha pilot suit]]
* [[V-fin]]
* "Pool:Awesome Mecha":[/pools/834]
* [[Tag group:Technology]]

title: gigi_murin's_september_karaoke_stream
body:
On the 21st of September 2024, [[Gigi Murin]] held an unarchived karaoke stream where she sang the song "September":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gs069dndIYk] by [[Earth Wind & Fire_(band)|]] continuously for eight hours straight.
While it started out normal, it later became more unusual with her singing in different ways, in various locations, and with different instruments.

Chat eventually started spamming a shoebox copypasta based on a "copypasta":[https://everything2.com/title/Crazy%253F+I+was+crazy+once.] from 2002.
[quote]Crazy? I was crazy once. They locked me in a shoebox. A shoebox on September. A shoebox on 21st of September. And 21st of September make me crazy. Crazy? I was crazy once.[/quote]

h4. External Links
* [s]"YouTube:【UNARCHIVED KARAOKE】get in the shoebox":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4wn2j1YQqEg][/s]
* "YouTube: Gigi Murin September UNARCHIVED KARAOKE":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3VYU-KI3xd8]
* "KnowYourMeme: Crazy? I Was Crazy Once. They Locked Me In A Room...":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/crazy-i-was-crazy-once-they-locked-me-in-a-room-a-rubber-room-a-rubber-room-with-rats-and-rats-make-me-crazy]

title: jiraiya_(naruto)
body:
A supporting character from [[Naruto (classic)|]] otherwise known by his nickname [b]Pervy Sage[/b] (エロ仙人, [i]ero sen'nin[/i]).

He is one of the Legendary Sannin along with [[Tsunade (naruto)|]] and [[Orochimaru (naruto)|]], all of whom trained under [[Sarutobi Hiruzen]] (The Third Hokage). He is the mentor of [[Namikaze Minato]] (The Fourth Hokage), and later [[Uzumaki Naruto]].

His animal motif is a [[frog]], mostly shown by summoning [[Gamabunta (Naruto)|Gamabunta]].

title: monster_hunter_(series)
body:
A video game series by Capcom.

As suggested by the title, the objective is to, as a [[Monster Hunter (character)|]], capture or slay an assortment of giant [[monster]]s, including [[wyvern]]s and [[dragon]]s.

h4. List of games

h6. First Generation

* Monster Hunter (PS2)
* [[Monster Hunter G]] (PS2)
* [[monster hunter portable|Monster Hunter Freedom]] (PSP)

h6. Second Generation

body:
A character from [[Mahou Shoujo No Majo Saiban]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Wears a [[white dress]] with a [[white veil]] on her head, similar to a [[priestess]].

Her magic power is "Healing".

[spoiler]It is revealed that she is the mastermind at the end of the first cycle of the game. It is also revealed that she was taken in as family by the last surviving "Great Witch", [[Tsukishiro Yuki]] as family.[/spoiler]

title: magic_mike
body:
A 2012 movie starring [[Channing Tatum]] as a [[male stripper]] named Michael "Magic Mike" Lane. The movie is very popular with women and surprisingly, straight men as well. 

The movie would later have two sequels, [b]Magic Mike XXL[/b] in 2015 and [b]Magic Mike's Last Dance[/b] in 2023.

title: unconventional_mermaid
body:
A [[mermaid]] or [[merman]] depicted differently from classical mermaids of the [[Disney]] variety. Common traits are a [[taur]] body, multiple and pronounced animalistic traits ([[sharp teeth]], [[webbed hands]], [[gills]] in uncommon places, extra fins), or being based on specific animals that aren't your average fish.

To qualify for this tag, a character must have a reasonable amount of these differences to be "unconventional". For example, just [[webbed hands]] or [[sharp teeth]] and nothing else are not enough.

h4. See also
* [[reverse mermaid]]

title: kolibri
body:
Also known as the [b]2.7mm Kolibri Car Pistol[/b], chambered in a proprietary 2mm [[ammunition|cartridge]]. Its name is German for "hummingbird". It was patented in 1910 and introduced in 1914 by Austrian watchmaker Franz Pfanni. Production quickly halted soon after due to [[World War I]], eventually discontinuing by 1938.
Notoriously known as one of, if not THE smallest firearm in history. While advertised to be a self-defense weapon for women, its usefulness was highly questionable due to the combined lack of accuracy, pathetic stopping power, and unwieldy design.

Gained some renewed infamy due to its inclusion in [[Battlefield 1]] as an unlockable weapon for the Scout kit, though its laughable in-game performance firmly cemented it as a joke weapon.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[kolibri (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: 2mm Kolibri":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2mm_Kolibri

title: bikini
body:
A bikini is a two-piece swimsuit for women, typically comprising a bra-like top and a panty-like bottom; however, the bottom can also be in the style of a [[bikini skirt]] or [[bikini shorts]].

Bikinis come in a wide range of styles, with most designed to reveal more of the body, especially around the [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]].

The key distinguishing feature of a bikini is that it prominently exposes the [[midriff]], whereas other types of two-piece swimsuits may have a higher waistline and/or a top that extends further to cover the area. However, it's worth noting that most modern two-piece swimsuits are, in fact, bikinis.

If only the bra portion of the bikini is worn, use [[bikini top only]]. Likewise, use [[bikini bottom only]] when only the panty portion is worn. If a character's bikini top and bottom don't match, use [[mismatched bikini]].

title: quake_1
body:
A first person shooter that was released by [[id Software]] in 1996 for the Pc and the first [[video game]] in the popular [[Quake (series)|]] series of video games. It is considered the first true 3D FPS game, unlike [[doom (series)|DooM]], which was actually 2.5D.

In the game, players must find their way out of various maze-like, medieval environments while battling a variety of monsters using a wide array of guns. The game's monsters were inspired by the creatures from [[h_p_lovecraft|H.P. Lovecraft]]'s [[Cthulhu Mythos]]. 

The successor to id's [[doom (series)|Doom]] series, Quake built upon the technology and gameplay of its predecessor in many ways. Unlike the Doom engine before it, the Quake engine offered full real-time 3D rendering and early support for 3D acceleration through OpenGL. 

Quake was programmed by John Carmack, Michael Abrash and John Cash. The level and scenarios were designed by American McGee, Sandy Petersen, John Romero and Tim Willits. The graphics were designed by Adrian Carmack, and Kevin Cloud. Music and sound design was by Trent Reznor, founder of [[Nine Inch Nails]]. The game engine developed for Quake, the "Quake engine", popularized several major advances in the 3D game genre: polygonal models instead of prerendered sprites; full 3D level design instead of a 2.5D map; prerendered lightmaps; and allowing end users to partially program the game (in this case with QuakeC), which popularized fan-created modifications or "mods".

After DooM helped popularize multiplayer deathmatches, Quake added various multiplayer options. Various multiplayer mods were developed including Team Fortress and Capture The Flag.

The game received much acclaim on release and its commercial success led to several sequels, starting with [[Quake 2]], which abandoned the gothic stylings of the original for a [[science fiction]] theme. Because of this, Quake has since been recognized as one of the greatest achievements of the video game industry, influencing games that came after it, as well as the artforms of user mods and machinima.

h4. See also

* [[Shambler]]
* [[Chthon (quake)|]]

title: watari_nina
body:
[b]The Apparition that Crafts Fictitious Cities[/b]

Extra Stage Boss of [[Fossilized Wonders]].

Nina is a newly-born "Shen":https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shen_(clam-monster) (a type of Mirage Youkai). She is [[barefoot]], has [[long_hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She wears a [[frilled dress]] with [[frilled sleeves]] and a [[shell hair ornament]]. Her portrait has her pose atop an [[oyster]] a la [[The Birth of Venus]]. A city of smoke can be seen behind her.

Junk data and misinformation from AI and the outside world shapes her worldview, leading her to believe in a myriad of conspiracies and nonsense as hidden, ultimate truths of the world.

title: new_jersey_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]Iowa[/i]-class battleship USS [i]New Jersey[/i] (BB-62). Character design by [[yyy (zelda10010)|yyy]], voiced by [[Tomita Miyu]].

She is the second natural UR ship in the game. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]], wears a black [[bodystocking]] with a futuristic style over[[coat]] on her shoulders, [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], white [[miniskirt]], bluish-chrome [[high heels]], and a headpiece with her hull number (BB-62) inscribed on it. She has an upbeat and flashy personality, rarely seen without a smile on her face.

Her [[rigging]] consists of her three 406 mm triple Mk7 mounts and four of her ten historical 127 mm twin mounts in an equally-futuristic rig with an electrically-charged glowing ring to her back.

She was launched on December 7th 1942, exactly one year after the Pearl Harbor attack. She took part in numerous actions from World War II to Vietnam and earned 19 battle stars in her long service before being decommissioned for the last time on February 8th 1991. Her historic counterpart is currently a museum ship located in Camden, New Jersey.

title: musashi_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Musashi[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Dishwasher1910]], voiced by [[Lynn (voice actor)|]]. 

Like her sister ship [[Shinano (Azur Lane)|]] and many Sakura Empire capital ships, she is a [[fox girl]]/[[kitsune]] with [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tails]], with [[very long hair|very long]] dark [[purple hair]], [[brown eyes]], [[facial mark]]s, and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit is also similar to Shinano's, but colored black, with a [[fur trim]] and a very [[low neckline]], blue print [[obi]], and possessing a [[magatama necklace]], big [[purple gemstone]] in the middle [[prayer beads]], and giant [[magatama]] on the beads. Her [[rigging]] consists of two giant mechanical hands similar to [i]Indianapolis[/i]' own rig but with two 15.5 cm triple secondary guns (one on each side), all three of her historical 460 mm triple main gun mounts on separate attachments, and a disembodied familiar behind her wielding a giant [[katana]] using the aforementioned mechanical arms.

title: northampton_ii_(azur_lane)
body: The personification of the [i]Oregon City[/i]-class heavy cruiser USS [i]Northampton[/i] (CA-125/CLC-1) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i] in her originally planned heavy cruiser configuration. Not to be confused with [[Northampton (Azur Lane)|her namesake predecessor, CA-26]], although it is specified that she has the body and memories of the original but with new equipment and abilities. Compared to the other "revenge ship" namesake, Northampton II features the most noticable design change. Her [[two-tone hair]] now features yellow inner hair instead of blue. Her hair is noticeably more voluminous, with her bangs now covering her entire forehead and her left eye. Her outfit consists of a black-and-white [[halterneck]] with [[underboob]] cutout, an assymertical [[short shorts]], a black [[bridal gauntlets]], and a [[military hat]]. Her [[rigging]] is a large wing-shaped device supporting two of her three turrets. h4. Appearance h6. title: naga_(fire_emblem)
body:
Naga is an ancient being considered a god in the lore of [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem]] (and by extention [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]), and [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]].

She is the most powerful of the Divine Dragons, the creator of legendary artifacts capable of defeating other dragons, including the [[falchion_(fire_emblem)|Falchion]]. In [i]Genealogy[/i], she additionally gives her blood to Saint [[Heim (Fire Emblem)|]], one of the Twelve Crusaders, which manifests as the [[Book of Naga]].

title: bike_shorts
body:
Tight, form-fitting athletic shorts composed of nylon and Spandex that reach about mid-thigh.

The primary purposes of bike shorts are to compress muscles (particularly the groin and thighs), prevent chafing, help remove sweat, keep muscles warm, and keep male genitals in place. There are two similar appearing types of these, compression shorts and bike shorts. Both types may be used without underwear, depending on if they were designed to act as underwear.

On Danbooru, the most common version depicted are compression shorts, which are used for a variety of sports and athletic activities. Compression shorts are similar to bike shorts, but aren't designed with biking in mind and thus lack things like padding to reduce discomfort from long rides. Compression shorts are sometimes used by some women to conceal their [[panties]] beneath their [[skirt]], especially for those in women's sports where their uniform has a skirt, such as [[field hockey]] or [[lacrosse]]. 

In Japan, these are also known as spats, and this meaning has spread across otaku spaces. They are considered a type of short [[leggings]] there. If you were searching for the Jazz Age footwear, go to [[spats (footwear)]].

h4. Types

* [[Bib shorts]]

h4. See also 

* [[Compression sleeve]]
* [[Shorts]] 
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: leggings
body:
Leg coverings similar to [[pantyhose]], but that don't cover the feet.

If the soles are covered but the toes and heels aren't, use [[stirrup legwear]] with [[pantyhose]] instead. If the leggings end at the thighs, like [[thighhighs]], tag [[detached leggings]] instead.

They are usually associated with '80s fashion; though they have made a comeback in the 2000s and are now a highly popular fashion trend among girls and women these days.

title: lwmmg_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[True Velocity RM338]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Would receive a [[LWMMG (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], LWMMG appears as [[Lam (neural cloud)|]].

title: knight_rider
body:
[i][b]Knight Rider[/b][/i] is a classic and very popular [[United states|American]] 80s [[science fiction]] and action [[television]] series created and produced by Glen A. Larson. The series was originally broadcast on NBC from 1982 to 1986. 

The show stars David Hasselhoff as [[Michael Knight]], a high-tech modern crime fighter assisted by [[K.I.T.T]], an advanced artificially intelligent, self-aware and nearly indestructible pitch black [[Pontiac Firebird]] sports [[car]].

h4. See also

* [[Dr. Bonnie Barstow]]
* [[Devon Miles]]
* [[April Curtis]] 
* [[Reginald Cornelius III]]

h4. External links

* "Original TV Series Intro (season 1)":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nBOh9HH1ocs
* "Knight Rider Season 3 Intro":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4AuN4UWr47c
* "Knight Rider Season 4 Intro":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=enUjYiHKQhk

title: recording
body:
Video recording taking place in the picture. Commonly demonstrated by framing the picture in a [[viewfinder]], or by putting ●REC or アナログ (analog) in the top left or right corners.

Can also be demonstrated by [[video camera]]s facing the participant being recorded.

h4. Examples

* [[Recording audio]]

title: flicking_penis
body: To strike the penis with a light, quick, snapping stroke of the finger. Often used to cause light pain as a punishment or as an expression of disappointment (usually at a [[small penis]].)

title: true_velocity_rm338
body:
The True Velocity RM338, formerly known as the Lightweight Medium Machine Gun (LWMMG), is an [[united states|American]] prototype belt-fed general-purpose [b][[machine gun]][/b] which was first developed by General Dynamics, then later by LoneStar Future Weapons, and now by True Velocity. It is designed to fill the gap between 7.62 mm and .50 BMG machine guns. The weapon uses the .338 Norma Magnum, giving it greater range compared to 7.62 NATO [[rifle cartridge|round]]. 

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[LWMMG (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia entry: "True Velocity RM338":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/True_Velocity_RM338]
